Maban residents and refugees from Blue Nile State have started fighting; both sides are destroying granaries, tents, houses. Maban residents demanded the refugees of Yusuf Batil and Gendrassa leave within two months (Gendrassa camp and Yusuf Batil camp are adjacent to each other).

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting in Baliet county and around Guel Guk area specifically.

In Bahrgel payam, about three miles from Wulu county, pastoralist clashed with military and police. Security forces were following the pastoralists and so the pastoralists decided to attack. 2 people were killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting reported in Kaka, Manyo County, UNS.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Reports of 1071 huts burned down and damage to the central market by the SPLA-In Opposition after fighting between the SPLA and SPLA-In Opposition.
Cattle raiding, suspected to be perpetrated by the Murle group, raided Garwer cattle camp.
300 security forces surrounded the home of the gender and human rights affairs Advisor, Adak Costa Mapour. They raided her home and assaulted her.
A senior police officer was shot by unidentified gunmen.
In Tambura town, Western Equatoria, a police officer was killed by unidentified gunmen while traveling to the market.

Change to armed group: Senior members of the SPLA defected to the SPLA-In Opposition. The announcement was made in Farajallah, 40 km south west of Wau in Bahr El Ghazal. Two rationales for the defection were: 1. To fight against Kiirs regime which was viewed as tyrannical and 2. the willingness of the SPLA-In Opposition to promote senior members of the SPLA to Major General.
Nuer IDPs residing at the UNMISS camp in Bor insulted and threw rocks at the Governor of Jonglei state when he visited the camp; no injuries were reported.
Movement of forces: Reports that the White Army is mobilising in Nasir.

SPLA fought the White Army in Twic County of Warrap State after an attack on civilians by the White Army which killed 14 females. 2 soldiers died. The government blamed the SPLA-In opposition for the attack.

Suspected attack by the White Army on Adama village of Twic Mayardit County in Warrap state. Attackers surrounded women while the women were collecting grass to thatch their huts. 14 women were killed and several abducted. The govt blamed the SPLA-In Opposition for the attack.
Protesters demanded schools and hospitals to be provided by the teak logging companies in Otogo Payam of Yei River County.

column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)

column6: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)

Police beat up a journalist whilst he was leaving the National Parliament building. The journalist was delivering newspapers. As a result of intimidation by the police, CTV and Citizen Newspaper have closed their operations.

column8: Twic East Area Youth Militia (South Sudan)

Community members attempted to stop the activities of some teak plantations by peacefully blocking workers but the workers responded violently, harming 5 people and sending one to the hospital.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: After the SPLA-In Opposition took over Bentiu, traders hiding in a mosuqe were killed while in other areas, civilians were lined up and killed and 5 were killed in Bentius hospital. 230 killed (45 killed after lined up, 180 killed in the mosque, 5 at the hospital) and 3 wounded. Reports lead to saying that the killings were based on ethnicity and nationality - the people targeted were: Nuer not supporting the opposition, Dinka, and Fur. The Dinka are seen as supporting Kiir and the Fur are viewed as members of JEM, which is supporting the SPLA.

A Fur trader was killed on the road between Warawar and Aweil Town by an unidentified armed group suspected of including members belonging to the military. The police made arrests - but the incident speaks to the increasing unease towards Fur traders in South Sudan.

column6: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Bor, Jonglei state, UNMISS reported yesterday that firing in the vicinity of its compound, apparently a case of friendly fire between the Ugandan Peoples Defence Forces (UPDF) and Auxiliary Police. UN peacekeepers calmed the situation, and also provided medical treatment to one displaced person who was wounded in the crossfire.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

Two students from Comboni Primary School and a pastoralist suffered critical injuries after gunman entered a room where they were sleeping and opened fire. There are reports the attack may have been related to inter-clan clashes between the Nyan and Joth sections.
Revenge attacks between Omorwo & Bari in Lowudo sub-district boma, Torit county, resulted in the death of 7 people

A group of stone-throwing displaced persons attacked construction workers building a temporary learning space for displaced children in UN House. Peacekeepers were able to control the situation but at least 2 people were injured.

Three people sustained gunshot wounds in Lakes states Rumbek Central county on Thursday after an attack by unknown gunman. According to Lakes state officials, the attack occurred after an earlier attack on a house in Malual-Akan while its occupants were sleeping.

Change to armed group: Defection of senior military officers from its fifth division covering the area of Warrap and Northern Bahr el Ghazal. Machars spokesperson, James Gatdet Dak, told Sudan Tribune that Brigadier General Peter Gatbel Wich, defected from Northern Bahr el Ghazal along with 400 fighters in protest over the alleged killing of unarmed Nuer military trainees at Mapel last week by ""soldiers loyal to president Salva Kiir.""

Security forces killed one man and injured another in Maridi county after a dispute erupted over the federalism debate. The soldiers were allegedly offended by civilians' discussions about federalism and demanded that those involved follow them to the military barracks, but the men reportedly refused.

Rebels accused government troops of killing 37 civilians in attacks in Riak and Mankien payams, Mayom county, on July 4-5.

Police officers staged a violent protest in Kwajok over non-payment of the May and June salaries. They fired into the air after they declined to accept an initial one-month payment. No injuries were reported.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Presidential Security Unit
column17: Presidential guard members robbed, terrorized, and beat citizens at night in Juba. 1 soldier was later arrested.
Non-violent activity: Government soldiers set up illegal checkpoints along Yei-Kaya and Yei-Juba roads to collected taxes from drivers and traders.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting continued between government and rebel forces in Nasir, with government forces claiming full control of the town

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting continued between government and rebel forces in Nasir, and the UN reported that rebel forces abandoned the town.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels looted Mayom-Kuol village in Aweil North before being chased out by government forces.

The Commissioner of Ezo County in Western Equatoria reported that ~30 armed horsemen (allegedly Ambororo) from Central African Republic clashed with army and home guard forces in Yangiri payam. 1 home guard was killed.
Security personnel reportedly arrested, detained and tortured 4 youth in Northern Bahr el Ghazal states. Sources confirmed the arrests by did not provide a reason.
A group of South Sudanese women held an anti-war protest in Juba, calling on warring parties to achieve peace at next weeks negotiations in Addis Ababa
IDPs in Unity state held a demonstration, calling on UNMISS to improve facilities at Rubkotna protection site after heavy flood waters washed out temporary shelters at the camp

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes were reported in Jonglei between 25-31 July

Arrests: Security agents arrested a number of youth and officials, most believed to have supported rebel forces as well as independent candidates who contested the 2010 general elections, in Northern Bahr el Ghazal.

column9: PPLF: Political Parties' Leadership Forum; UDSF: United Democratic Salvation Front
column17: Non-violent activity: The government declared 10 political party representatives illegal incl. members of Political Parties Leadership Forum (PPLF) and United Democratic Salvation Front (UDSF), and announced they are not allowed to participate in peace talks in Addis Ababa

Agreement: David Yau Yau was appointed head of the Greater Pibor Area Administration, following the signing into law the Yau Yau peace accord recognizing the formation of the Greater Pibor Administrative Area in Jonglei.

At least 4 Sudanese soldiers were killed and 2 captured in am ambush laid by SPLA forces at Toma South and Khath El Nar oil fields in Pariang county, when they were caught trying to loot copper cables.

column7: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Change to armed group: Two South Sudanese youth organisations National Youth Union (NYU) and Greater Equatoria Youth Leadership (GEYL) signed a memorandum of understanding on collective efforts to overthrow the government (with the formation of a Joint Coordination Committees, incl. a security and protection committee), in support of SPLM/A-In Opposition.

column9: SSCSA: South Sudan Civil Society Alliance
column17: The chairman of the South Sudan Civil Society Alliance survived an assassination attempt when he was shot and injured by unknown gunmen in Juba.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Deserting Nuer soldiers clashed with Mabanese Defence Forces in and around Bunj, Maban county. 2 soldiers and 4 Maban fighters were killed. Mabanese Defence Forces went door to door searching people of Nuer ethnicity.

Between 3-5 August 2014, as many as 12 Sudanese traders were killed in Duru, Youssef Batail, Kaya, and Ginderasa camps around Bunj (Maban, Upper Nile), during ongoing clashes between Mabanese Defense Forces and Nuer soldiers. It is unclear whether they were killed during fighting or if they were targeted. (Total of 12 fatalities equally divided across 3 events.)

column9: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: On 4 August 2014, Mabanese Defence Forces shot and killed a humanitarian aid worker from Norwegian Peoples Aid around Bunj after asking to know the ethnicity of aid workers.

Between 3-5 August 2014, as many as 12 Sudanese traders were killed in Duru, Youssef Batail, Kaya, and Ginderasa camps around Bunj (Maban, Upper Nile), during ongoing clashes between Mabanese Defense Forces and Nuer soldiers. It is unclear whether they were killed during fighting or if they were targeted. (Total of 12 fatalities equally divided across 3 events.)

column16: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Nuba Reports; UN (unspecified)
column17: Fighting continued between Mabanese Defence Forces and deserting Nuer soldiers in Bunj. White Army fighters were also reported to be involved in clashes in Bunj. Mabanese Defence Forces went door to door searching people of Nuer ethnicity.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Fighting continued between Mabanese Defence Forces and deserting Nuer soldiers in Bunj. Mabanese Defence Forces went door to door searching people of Nuer ethnicity.

column9: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: On 5 Aug 2014, Mabanese Defence Forces killed at least 5 Nuer aid workers in and around Bunj town (2 in town, 3 in an ambush near town), based on their ethnicity. A 6th worker is missing and presumed dead.

Between 3-5 August 2014, as many as 12 Sudanese traders were killed in Duru, Youssef Batail, Kaya, and Ginderasa camps around Bunj (Maban, Upper Nile), during ongoing clashes between Mabanese Defense Forces and Nuer soldiers. It is unclear whether they were killed during fighting or if they were targeted. (Total of 12 fatalities equally divided across 3 events.)

A police officer from Western Bahr el Ghazal reportedly opened fire on the car of the Tonj South county commissioner in Kapara boma, Warrap state. It is thought the attack could be related to a border dispute between Warrap and Western Bahr el Ghazal.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; Catholic Radio Network; Sudan Tribune
column17: Unknown gunmen killed the paramount chief of three Athoi chieftaincies in Rumbek East, who is an elder brother of the Lakes State caretaker governor. He was killed at his home in Pacong payam, Rumbek East county. It was later stated that the killing might be in retaliation for the killing of another chief in 2002 by the governor's son. Members of the Thuyic sub-clan are thought to have been responsible.
Migrant cattle herders clashed with residents of Kozoro in Mundri West county. Cattle herders took control of Kozoro village, causing the displacement of hundreds of people.

column9: Thuyic Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
column17: At least 13 women of the Thuyic sub-clan were raped in Makuac and Panbarkou villages, near Malekagok area, Rumbek East, following the killing of a paramount chief on 05/08. Supporters of the late chief are believed to be responsible for the rapes, and also looted the areas.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Movement of forces: The army accused rebels of massive mobilisation in Ayot County, Jonglei, in preparation for an offensive against military positions.

Youth vandalised four primary schools in Pachong payam, Rumbek east, following the killing of a paramount chief on Aug 5. The youth were reportedly looking for students to kill in retaliation for the chief's murder.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels are accused of attacking Yirol area, Lakes state, looting livestock and injuring civilians.

An unknown gunmen, possibly from Rumbek East county, killed 2 people in Ayeicok, Duony payam, Cueibet county. One of the victims was from the Pan-Nhaich of the Gok section, while the other was from the Dinka Agaar section of Rumbek East county. The attack may be related to the killing of a Rumbek paramount chief of 05/08.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces clashed in Nasir area. At least 31 and as many as 41 rebels were reported killed. The government accused the rebels of attacking government positions, while rebels reported that government forces attacked their positions in Ketbek (2km SE of Nasir town).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces fought for control of Bentiu

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels reported that 5 government soldiers were killed and 2 rebel fighters injured during clashes in Kaljak payam, Rubkona county.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions at Kal-Jak, Maan-Kuach and Thoan military outposts in Rupkoni and Guit counties, Unity state
2 people were killed in Makuragar village near Akot payam in targeted killings by unknown gunmen.
Clashes broke out in Ayen cattle camp (~10km from Rumbek Central county), reportedly a revenge attack by Nyang section against a Rup section sub-clan. 3 men were wounded and 1 person was killed.
Security forces in Rumbek arrested and reportedly tortured a Wulu chief who allegedly refused to share information on the whereabouts of suspects in the killing a paramount chief on Aug 5.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions at Kal-Jak, Maan-Kuach and Thoan military outposts in Rupkoni and Guit counties, Unity state

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions at Kal-Jak, Maan-Kuach and Thoan military outposts in Rupkoni and Guit counties, Unity state

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions in Rubkona.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces clashed near Nhialdiu, south of Bentiu, reportedly following a rebel attack. At least 7 rebels were reported killed, along with 1 soldier. The rebels denied the attacks.
Rebels accused the government of planting landmines along the Manga-Heglig-Bentiu road

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels claimed to have captured Rubkona town. Rebels claimed that more than 150 government troops were killed during fighting in Unity state on Aug 15.
Heavy fighting broke out among students of Rumbek National Secondary School, reportedly beginning with a fight between a boy who eloped with a girl and the girl's relatives.
The UN reported a 'recent' attack on a female aid worker in Bentiu, though no additional details were provided.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces clashed in Ayod, Jonglei state. The army reported that the rebels attacked government positions, and that 120 rebels and 6 soldiers were killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government forces attacked rebel positions at Nhialdiu

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Movement of forces: The military reported that rebel forces are crossing into Unity state from Sudan with heavy military equipment and weapons, suggesting that Khartoum may be aiding the rebels.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting broke out in Guit, Kaljak and Kuergueyni areas, Unity state. Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions in these areas. Rebels claimed that more than 150 government troops were killed during fighting in Unity state on Aug 15.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces clashed at the Bentiu-Rubkona bridge. Rebels claimed that more than 150 government troops were killed during fighting in Unity state on Aug 15.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting broke out in Guit, Kaljak and Kuergueyni areas, Unity state. Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions in these areas. Rebels claimed that more than 150 government troops were killed during fighting in Unity state on Aug 15.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting broke out in Guit, Kaljak and Kuergueyni areas, Rubkona area, Unity state. Rebels accused government forces of attacking their positions in these areas. Rebels claimed that more than 150 government troops were killed during fighting in Unity state on Aug 15.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces clashed in Bentiu town. Rebels claimed to have captured Bentiu. Rebels claimed that more than 150 government troops were killed during fighting in Unity state on Aug 15.

Fighting continued in Rumbek town market among students of Rumbek National Secondary School, reportedly beginning with a fight between a boy who eloped with a girl and the girl's relatives. Police intervened, opening fire and arresting 16 students.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes broke out within opposition ranks in Renk

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels reportedly attacked Bouth, Mayom, but were repulsed by government forces. 'A dozen' rebels were reported killed and 7 soldiers wounded.
4 people were killed in separate incidents in Rumbek Central and Rumbek East in targeted killings by unknown gunmen.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a church in Paguor payam, Cueibet county, shooting and killing a priest and 2 other people.

Government soldiers opened fire into the air near the Bentiu UN base, injuring a child. The UN reported 'sustained gunfire' around the base. Some reports said that the soldiers were celebrating war veterans' day.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The UN mission reported 'sporadic fighting' south of its base in Bentiu
Government forces shot and killed ""a number"" of civilians around the Rubkona airstrip

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Looting: The Mayom County Commissioner accused rebels from Guit, Koch, and Rubkona of raiding 5000 cattle from Gutnyang, south of Wangkei, in Mayom county, Unity state

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: It was reported that fighting broke out among government soldiers at a military outpost in Tore, Yei county, after a group of soldiers and a colonel defected to the rebels. The rebel soldiers reportedly took control of Tore, although the Yei county commissioner denied that the fighting had taken place.
Cattle raiders from Lakes state attacked Mvolo county, stealing more than two dozen cattle and killing a member of security forces.
A suspected cattle raider was killed in Rumbek East by unknown gunmen

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes broke out in Anakdiar (Nagdiar?) area, Upper Nile, following a rebel attack

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes broke out in Doleib area, Upper Nile, following a rebel attack on the Doleib military base

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Journalists (South Sudan)
column17: National Security Service forces detained 2 national UNMISS staff, including a security guard and a journalist from Radio Miraya, in Wau, reportedly accusing them of having links with rebels. The security guard was taken to Juba the next day and initially detained at the NSS riverside detention facility. In early 2015, he was transferred to the NSS headquarters in Jebel, and in January 2016, he was transferred back to the NSS riverside detention facility. Any access to him has been denied since December 2015. He has allegedly been subjected to torture or other ill treatment while in NSS detention.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Members of the South Sudanese NSS arrested a UNMISS security guard in Wau over suspicion of supporting or being in contact with SPLA-IO, and transferred him to a detention faciliity in Juba. In early 2015 he was transferred to the NSS headquarters in Jebel, and transferred back to Juba early 2016. As of 14 December 2016, he remained detained without charge. He has been reportedly subjected to torture and other ill-treatment while in detention.

Unknown assailants killed the paramount chief of Kaka area, Upper Nile. A local group accused local government-allied militia of responsibility. The chief was the second-in-command of the Collo Resistance Front, an opposition group.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebel forces detained 6 members of the IGAD ceasefire monitoring and verification team and 3 aircrew in Bouth, near Bentiu, Unity state. 1 team member, an SPLA liaison officer, died of natural causes during the detention period. Rebels later accused IGAD of aiding government spies.

At least 2 soldiers were killed following a 'random shoot-out' at Wanyjok market, Aweil East, N. Bahr el Ghazal. Witnesses and local authorities reported that shots were fired during attempts to disarm a drunken soldier, while military sources attributed to incident to frustration among soldiers.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes were reported in Ayod county between Aug 22-28
Non-violent activity: The government removed 23 members of parliament who were in conflict with the government, including a number who had joined the rebel movement.
A UN cargo helicopter was shot down near Bentiu, killing 3 Russian crew members and injuring 1. Rebels and government forces traded blame for the attack.
Unknown gunmen killed 2 people in Manyiel amidst ongoing inter-clan violence in Rumbek Central county.
Suspected pastoralists attacked and opened fire on Cuei-Adukan, Rumbek Central, killing 1 person and injuring at least 2 others.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebel forces reportedly launched a shelling attack on government positions in Nasir county

column6: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Looting: Members of the Bor section are suspected of carrying out an attack against a cattle camp in Manyiel, Rumbek Central. 20 cows were killed during the attack.
12 people were reported killed in a revenge attack along the Torit-Omorwo road. The incident is reportedly linked to a series of revenge attacks between 2 communities in the area.
Unknown gunmen, suspected to be Baari youth, killed 9 women and 3 children in Baari village, Loudo boma, Bur payam.
Pakam youth are suspected of attacking a Rup section cattle camp in Akop, killing 2 people

A group of chiefs and elders (including elders from the Rup Dinka section) from Rumbek Central staged a peaceful protest against Lakes state caretaker governor Matur Chut Dhuol over ongoing violence in the county.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: At least 30 people were killed in fighting between government and opposition forces in Nasir.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Opposition fighters are reportedly shooting at civilians (often seeking medical treatment in government-held Ayod town) to prevent them from crossing the frontline in Ayod, Jonglei state.
South Sudanese soldiers reportedly brutalised Ugandans whom they arrested near the border and detained in Mere prison, Kajo-Keji county.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels were reported to be stealing cattle from Nuer residents who refuse to fight the government, resulting in clashes and unspecified deaths in villages around Nasir

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebel and government forces reportedly clashed in Renk county, Upper Nile state

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Health Workers (South Sudan)
column17: ""One ICRC-contracted driver was shot and wounded when the convoy he was traveling with was robbed by armed men.""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Armed men believed to be rebels killed 2 brothers, torched 3 houses, and killed some cattle in Wunamith village, NE of Renk town, Upper Nile state.
Soldiers in Malakal started shooting at one another following the non-payment of salaries. One soldier was killed during the shooting

Secondary school students in Raja County of Western Bahr al Ghazal State protested over the closure of their school due to the non-payment of teachers by the government. Students broke windows and doors of the County Education Office. Security forces dispersed the protesters by firing into the crowd and arresting several students.
Cattle raiders attacked Choldong cattle camp in Rumbek North on Sept 6 and 7. County authorities accused Cueibet youth of responsibility for the attack.

column8: Adol Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Clashes broke out between Thuch and Adeel clans in Tonj East, Warrap State on Sept 7-8, following disagreement over the elopement/abduction of a woman. At least 40 people were reported killed and 66 wounded on Sept 8.

Cattle raiders attacked Choldong cattle camp in Rumbek North on Sept 8, 9 and 10. 1 raider was killed on Sept 8. 2 raiders were killed and 20 cattle stolen on Sept 9. 3 civilians were killed between Sept 8-10. County authorities accused Cueibet youth of responsibility for the attack.

Cattle raiders attacked Choldong cattle camp in Rumbek North on Sept 8, 9 and 10. 1 raider was killed on Sept 8. 2 raiders were killed and 20 cattle stolen on Sept 9. 3 civilians were killed between Sept 8-10. County authorities accused Cueibet youth of responsibility for the attack.
Students in Rumbek boycotted classes in protest over the use of the new South Sudanese curriculum. 300 students believed to be behind the protest were suspended.

Hundreds of farmers from Kaka, Jalhak and Geiger in northern Upper Nile state protested after they were allegedly excluded from a distribution of government funding intended for farmers in the state. They accused the Farmers Union of receiving funding and distributing money to staff instead of farmers.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a senior police officer in his home in Chumchok area, Lakes state.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Recruitment: Rebels in Guit and Nhialdieu are reportedly recruiting local youth in preparation for an attack on government forces in Bentiu

column6: Former Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Non-violent activity: Soldiers who have deserted from the army have set up an illegal road block between Rech Ayen and Mading Jokthing in Abyei, and are illegally collecting taxes from residents.

Hundreds of farmers from Kaka, Jalhak and Geiger in northern Upper Nile state protested after they were allegedly excluded from a distribution of government funding intended for farmers in the state. They accused the Farmers Union of receiving funding and distributing money to staff instead of farmers.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Non-violent activity: Rebels near Bentiu reportedly received ammunition from Sudan in preparation for an attack on government forces in Bentiu

Hundreds of farmers from Kaka, Jalhak and Geiger in northern Upper Nile state protested after they were allegedly excluded from a distribution of government funding intended for farmers in the state. They accused the Farmers Union of receiving funding and distributing money to staff instead of farmers.

column9: PPLF: Political Parties' Leadership Forum; SPLM-DC: Sudan People's Liberation Movement (Democratic Change); SPLM-DC: Sudan PeopleOs Liberation Movement (Democratic Change)
column17: Non-violent activity: The government reportedly imposed a travel ban on the leader of the opposition SPLM-DC and of the Political Parties Leadership Forum (PPLF), Lam Akol, preventing him from taking part in ongoing peace talks in Addis Ababa.

Cattle raiders attacked Choldong cattle camp in Rumbek North on Sept 8, 9 and 10. 1 raider was killed on Sept 8. 2 raiders were killed and 20 cattle stolen on Sept 9. 3 civilians were killed between Sept 8-10. County authorities accused Cueibet youth of responsibility for the attack.

Suspected Gok Dinka pastoralists killed 5 people in a car in Mayath payam, Rumbek North, including a son and female relative of the Paramount Chief whose murder in August set off a waves of revenge attacks and killings.

Following the killing of the son of a late paramount chief in Mayath payam by suspected Gok Dinka pastoralists on Sept 11, his relatives began stopping cars in Pacong and killing those with traditional skin markings of Cueibet county (Gok Dinka). The number of people killed was not specified.
More than 200 residents of Hai Kosti near Konyo Konyo market in Juba blocked a road when a bulldozer was sent to raze their homes, in protest over their eviction from the area

Unknown gunmen, bearing markings similar to those of Cueibet youth, killed a senior military officer and his 2 bodyguards in Pacong payam, Rumbek East. It was later reported that Gok clan youth were suspected of responsibility for the attack.

Movement of forces: The SPLA has said it has deployed a battalion of troops along its border with Sudan following repeated rebel raids on its territory, particularly recent attacks on Renk, that it believes are being staged from Sudanese territory.
Drivers along the Yei-Maridi road have reported that soldiers have been harassing them and beating them with firewood.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels have reportedly killed farmers in their fields in Renk area. The number of people killed was not specified.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""One UN staff member was assaulted by SPLA soldiers and required medical treatment. Another UN staff member was also assaulted, but seems to have been unhurt.""
9 people from Mayath payam, Cueibet county, were killed during inter-clan clashes
5 people from Pakam community were killed in Rumbek North, in a revenge attack for the killing of a Rup community member on the same day by gunmen suspected to be from Rumbek North
A Rup community member was killed by gunmen suspected to be from Rumbek North

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebel forces are accused of attacking government forces at Duk Duk area, Upper Nile.
Arrests: 27 youth suspected of involvement in inter-clan clashes in Tonj East on Sept 7-8 have been arrested.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Opposition forces captured Gongbaar (Gangbar), Upper Nile following clashes with government forces. At least 4 rebels were reported killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between opposition and government forces were reported at Amdhalwich, two kilometers from Gongbaar, Upper Nile.
Unknown gunmen killed the director of land and survey in his home in Cueibet county. The killing was reportedly a targeted revenge attack linked to an inter-clan fued.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Members of the South Sudanese NSS arrested a UNMISS staff member working in the civil affairs division at the Old market in Torit over suspicion of supporting or being in contact with SPLA-IO, and transferred him to a detention faciliity in Juba. In June 2015 he was transferred to the NSS headquarters in Jebel. As of 14 December 2016, he remained detained without charge, and his family unaware of his whereabouts. He has been reportedly subjected to torture and other ill-treatment while in detention.
South Sudanese women, dressed in black to mourn the death of peace in their country, held a silent protest on the streets of Juba against the war and the failure of leaders to end the fighting

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and rebel forces clashed in Dukduk area.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting broke out between government and rebel forces following rebel attacks on government troops near Agon-Bar, NE of Renk.Clashes also continued in Gangbar area, near Renk. Rebel forces bombed, burned, and looted villages as they retreated from Renk

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebel forces shelled government forces in Renk town.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column7: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column9: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: NSS and military intelligence arrested and beat a Nuer humanitarian worker in Bor.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes continued between rebel and government forces in Renk County. Rebel forces reportedly captured 4 areas around Renk on Sept 19.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes reported at Doleib Hill area, following a rebel attack on government positions. Government forces repulsed the rebels.

1 South Sudanese man was killed and 3 others injured when a group of Ugandans attacked across the border with machetes and clubs in the Sunyu area. They also set 12 homesteads on fire. Other reports claim ""tens"" of people were killed.
Agreement: At least 63 members of the UDAF in Aweil, Northern Bahr el Ghazal, led by their deputy chairman Amath Riing Lual, have joined Salva Kiir's Juba-based SPLM/A.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: 168 bodies of opposition fighters were recovered and 11 SPLA soldiers reported killed after fighting on Saturday around Renk and the village of Payuer.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebel forces reportedly captured 5 areas around Nasir on Sept 20.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: 168 bodies of opposition fighters were recovered and 11 SPLA soldiers reported killed after fighting on Saturday around Renk and the village of Payuer.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between government forces and rebels have been reported near Malakal.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between government forces and rebels have been reported near Renk.

Food distribution at Yida refugee campwas disrupted when heavy shooting by unidentified gunmen occurred. It was not reported if there were any casualties, or if the shooting targeted the refugees or food distributors.
Hundreds of people engaged in a walk for peace in Juba.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese military forces say they are now fully in control of Renk.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Over 25 civilians have been reported killed by rebel forces in the areas of Daba, Chambor and Majak near Renk which are inhabited by Dinka. They were allegedly targeted based on ethnicity.
A group of Leer youths responded to a Thiik attack by killing 1 woman and 1 young man in Akok Tek.

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Unidentified gunmen opened fire on an American forces vehicle near Namaiku village, injuring one soldier.

column9: Civilians (South Sudan); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Unknown gunmen killed an Egyptian national on the road from Juba to Rumbek. A policeman and a pastoralist were also killed in the shooting.

A group of Thiik youths attacked a cattle camp near Kirik payam, killing 10 Leer and wounding at least 7. 6 attackers were arrested and 1 was killed in a shootout, while 2 others were wounded. 300 cattle were seized.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: 5 people were wounded in an attack by South Sudanese rebels on the village of Hamara, causing many to flee into the bush.
2 people were killed and 1 wounded after unidentified gunmen opened fire at a public bus. They did not attempt to rob the passengers.
At least 5 people were killed and 4 injured when unidentified gunmen attacked passengers on the Rumbek-Wulu highway. No arrests were made; it was believed to be a revenge attack.

""""South Sudans opposition forces have accused the government of using long-range artillery to shell centres for internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Jonglei states Pigi county over the weekend.""""
Clashes in Cueibet left 9 people from one family, and 3 of their attackers, dead. It is believed to be a revenge attack due to the targeting of the family.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Recruitment: SPLA-IO forces have been reported to have been recruiting Rizeigat tribesmen by offering money in preparation for an attack on Bentiu.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces have accused government forces of shelling several positions under control of their fighters, including Kuer Guina in Guit, Thou-Maan-Gor in ""Rupkona"" and Wang-Kei in Mayom.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: 2 people were killed near the protection site at the UNMISS base in Bentiu. They were believed to have been stabbed by people loyal to the rebels who were taking shetler at the UN-protected camp.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces have accused government forces of shelling several positions under control of their fighters, including Kuer Guina in Guit, Thou-Maan-Gor in ""Rupkona"" and Wang-Kei in Mayom.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces have accused government forces of shelling several positions under control of their fighters, including Kuer Guina in Guit, Thou-Maan-Gor in ""Rupkona"" and Wang-Kei in Mayom.
At least 6 South Sudan army soldiers were killed and 14 injured after clashes at the Yei military barracks due to a dispute over salaries.
Fighting was reported between pastoralists and farmers in Mundri, following cattle allegedly damaging crops.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO has been accused of forcibly recruiting civilians on the Upper Nile-Sudan border, including about 20 taken by opposition fighters near Joda North checkpoint and taken to a training centre near Jenbelain area of Sudans White Nile.

9 people were killed and 4 wounded in an attack allegedly carried out by Rumbek North youth on Abiriu Payam. 17 cows were killed and 20 other injured as well. The raid occurred at night so no counter-attack could be launched in time.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese military sources have accused rebels of shelling their positions in Renk, Doleib and Ayod.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese military sources have accused rebels of shelling their positions in Renk, Doleib and Ayod.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese military sources have accused rebels of shelling their positions in Renk, Doleib and Ayod.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Intense clashes were reported around Renk between rebels and government forces.
Dozens of members of the disabled community demonstrated for peace and against South Sudans ongoing civil war. They presented petitions at the UNMISS base and to the state government.

At least 3 people were killed after gunfights between SPLA-Juba faction soldiers and an unidentified group of locals in Chukudum. Some of those killed were allegedly unarmed civilians. The clash was reportedly triggered by the death of a primary school teacher while in government custody.

column7: SPLM-DC: Sudan People's Liberation Movement (Democratic Change); SPLM-DC: Sudan PeopleOs Liberation Movement (Democratic Change)
column17: Opposition members and some ruling party lawmakers walked out of parliament to protest the passing of a ""repressive"" security bill.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese rebels have claimed to have killed 2 Ugandan soldiers fighting alongside South Sudanese government forces during renewed clashes in Upper Nile state in and around Malakal.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: ""Heavy gunfire and explosions were heard around Malakal town, forcing shops to close and residents to stay indoors.""

column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: 3 South Sudanese UN contractors were kidnapped by 20 gunmen in civilian clothes in Malakal. 2 were later released but a third is still missing.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese rebel forces allegedly carried out attacks on the Obel (Ashanbenil) and Doleib Hill areas, but were repulsed by government forces. Military sources say Doleib Hill is contested but that Obel is completely under government forces. Rebels say that government forces have retreated back to Malakal and that an estimated 400-500 governmnt troops were killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels have stated that Ugandan forces bombarded their positions with jet fighters and helicopter gunships, as well as airlifted troops to Malakal to assist in fighting there.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune
column17: Rebel forces and the SPLM National Coordination Office in the US have claimed that forces loyal to Salva Kiir have executed 27 soldiers of Nuer ethnicity at Anakdiar. The government has denied these claims.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune
column17: Rebel forces and the SPLM National Coordination Office in the US have claimed that forces loyal to Salva Kiir have executed 25 soldiers of Nuer ethnicity in the Bailiet area east of Malakal. The government has denied these claims.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column16: Sudan Tribune; South Sudan News Agency
column17: Rebel forces and the SPLM National Coordination Office in the US have claimed that forces loyal to Salva Kiir have executed a brigadier general of Nuer ethnicity in Paloich. The government has denied these claims.

Hundreds of angry street children hurled stones at shops and local residents in Waus marketplace following the death of a child discovered on Oct.10. Police detained dozens of the children and have said they will remain in police custody while the police look into the death.

column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: A South Sudanese UN contractor with the WFP was kidnapped at Malakal airport by 8 men in plain clothes. There are conflicting reports whether the men were intelligence security agents or part of a pro-government militia.
Operators of public buses on the routes between Konyo Konyo and Lologo in Juba have suspended transport services protesting the poor state of the road.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An IGAD report recorded clashes in Manyo county on Oct.19 as an instance of Government Forces breaking their ceasefire commitment.
1 man was killed in a raid on a village along the Bor-Juba road about 40km from Bor.
Local traders in Juba protested against the demolition of market stalls near Juba bus station.

column16: World Bulletin; Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Eye Radio (South Sudan)
column17: At least 15 government soldiers, including 4 senior army officers, were killed in clashes between the army and armed pastoralists in the Malek and Aguoc areas in Rumbek beginning on Thursday. Some soldiers are said to be missing following the fighting. At least 9 pastoralists were killed and there were reportedly also civilian casualties but specific numbers were not reported. The soldiers weapons were looted by the pastoralists.

column16: World Bulletin; Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio (South Sudan)
column17: At least 15 government soldiers, including 4 senior army officers, were killed in clashes between the army and armed pastoralists in the Malek and Aguoc areas in Rumbek beginning on Thursday. Some soldiers are said to be missing following the fighting. At least 9 pastoralists were killed and there were reportedly also civilian casualties but specific numbers were not reported. The soldiers weapons were looted by the pastoralists.
A group of 20 lawmakers from Lakes state parliament protested the arrest of 2 senior lawmakers by marching to the Lakes state police station and engaging in a sit-in.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; World Bulletin; Eye Radio (South Sudan)
column17: Clashes are reported to have continued between government forces and pastoralists. The death toll among soldiers and policemen has been reported at 72, including 35 policemen and 37 soldiers, while 12 pastoralists have also been killed, with dozens more wounded. 7 civilians were also said to have been wounded by gunfire.

column16: Eye Radio (South Sudan); World Bulletin; Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Clashes are reported to have continued between government forces and pastoralists. The death toll among soldiers and policemen has been reported at 72, including 35 policemen and 37 soldiers, while 12 pastoralists have also been killed, with dozens more wounded. 7 civilians were also said to have been wounded by gunfire.
2 traditional chiefs were killed by unidentified gunmen near in Ayen Mayar village in Rumbek East county.

column16: World Bulletin; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune
column17: Clashes are reported to have continued between government forces and pastoralists. The death toll among soldiers and policemen has been reported at 72, including 35 policemen and 37 soldiers, while 12 pastoralists have also been killed, with dozens more wounded. 7 civilians were also said to have been wounded by gunfire.

column16: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; World Bulletin
column17: Clashes are reported to have continued between government forces and pastoralists. The death toll among soldiers and policemen has been reported at 72, including 35 policemen and 37 soldiers, while 12 pastoralists have also been killed, with dozens more wounded. 7 civilians were also said to have been wounded by gunfire.

Renewed clashes between pastoralists and security forces broke out at Apet cattle camp. 3 soldiers and 9 civilians were killed during the fighting. A military vehicle loaded with ammunition was seized b the pastoralists.

More than 60 civilians were injured, 4 seriously, during a ""huge brawl"" in UN House Protection of Civilians site on the outskirts of Juba. 2 armed UN police officers also suffered minor injuries. Police fired tear gas and warning shots to halt the rioting. 2 people were arrested on suspicion of instigating the violence. The rioting began on Sunday and was brought under control in the late afternoon on Monday.
Clashes broke out in Dor Payam in Awerial county. 3 people were killed during the clashes when they attempted to mediate during the two sides. 8 others were also injured.

More than 60 civilians were injured, 4 seriously, during a ""huge brawl"" in UN House Protection of Civilians site on the outskirts of Juba. 2 armed UN police officers also suffered minor injuries. Police fired tear gas and warning shots to halt the fighting. 2 people were arrested on suspicion of instigating the violence. The rioting began on Sunday and was brought under control in the late afternoon on Monday.
6 cattle keepers were killed, 1 woman was kidnapped and 3 others wounded after an attack on a cattle camp at Amadi Payam. Hundreds of cows were stolen but many have since been returned.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The Unity state government announced rebel forces have captured Kilo 30 (Sikasik) after launching an attack on government forces near Bentiu.
2 people were killed by unidentified gunmen while riding a motorcycle near Madangere Payam, about 40km from Yambio.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels attacked Wankei payam, but were repulsed by government forces. They suffered unspecified losses.

4 civilians were injured and 1 person killed after fighting broke out between Nuer and Shilluk IDPs sheltering in the UN base in Malakal town after a female security guard was beaten by Nuer tribesmen. 4 UN peacekeepers suffered minor injuries as they tried to break up the two groups; they used tear gas to disperse the rioters.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes took place in Bentiu, during which 10 civilians died.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Heavy clashes occurred in Bentiu and Rubkona. Rebels claimed victory in Bentiu, but the government has disputed they took the town. At least 23 civilians have been confirmed killed during the clashes. The attacks came from the south and east from Guit, Nhialdiu and Rubkona. However, a rebel spokesman has denied that Riek Machar ordered the attack.
At least 5 people from boths sides were killed and 8 people injured during inter-communal clashes in Rumbek East amongst the Kok sub-clan following the killing of 2 chiefs in Ayen Mayer last week.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Heavy clashes occurred in Bentiu and Rubkona. Rebels claimed victory in Bentiu, but the government has disputed they took the town. At least 23 civilians have been confirmed killed during the clashes. No reports on casualties among the combatants.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes occurred in Wangkai but casualties were not reported. Soldiers were wounded and taken to Agok and Turalei.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column9: Christian Group (South Sudan); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
column17: A UN human rights report was released describing the killing of 11 civilians who were identified as Nuer, including 8 taken from a Catholic church, as well as he rape of at least 20 women during their occupation of Bentiu on Oct.29.
Gunfire was heard around 8:00pm in the Jabarona area of Juba. An SPLA spokesman said that a convoy of police and soldiers ran into a group of ""criminals"" and a clash followed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting continued in Bentiu between rebels and government forces on the main road, very close to the UN compound where civilians are taking cover. 2 civilians were killed and 6 others wounded during the fighting. At least 100 SPLA-Juba soldiers have been killed, and 50 seriously wounded while at least 375 SPLA-IO soldiers have been killed, and 12 civilians wounded by gunfire, in the last 4 days of fighting around Bentiu and Rubkona.

6 people from Tonj East raided Tonjy North and stole over 30 cattle. A gun battle erupted when the owner of the cattle from Tonj North intercepted the raiders. 1 Tonj East youth was killed and 1 Tonj North resident was injured; the cattle were recovered.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces crossed the Sobat river and attacked SPLA-Juba forces near Doleib. Heavy shelling of SPLA-Juba positions were reported.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Sudan Vision
column17: 2 Antonov aircraft believed to belong to the SAF bombed a wide and heavily populated area around Khor Shamam in Raja county at 2am, killing 35 and wounding 17 people. The SAF denies that it bombed the area.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An IGAD report has recorded clashes in Malakal county between Nov.2-4 as instances of Government Forces breaking their ceasefire commitment.
Hundreds of people have demonstrated in the streets of Wau to protest against the air raid near Raja and demand an end to the attacks and an international investigation.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces claim they recaptured Khorfulus during a counterattack against SPLA-Juba forces.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes were reported at Atar, Canal and other small towns around Pigi county.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Heavy shelling of SPLA-Juba forces by the SPLA-IO was reported on Monday.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An IGAD report has recorded clashes in Malakal county between Nov.2-4 as instances of Government Forces breaking their ceasefire commitment.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government sources claim their forces clashed with SPLA-IO forces near Khorfulus and took control of the area after a counterattack against SPLA-IO forces which attacked them near Doleib. Rebels say government forces also shelled their positions near Canal, south of Doleib.
A policeman with the prison service was killed and a women injured when unidentified armed men attacked Wunpiem near Nabagok.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An IGAD report has recorded clashes in Malakal county between Nov.2-4 as instances of Government Forces breaking their ceasefire commitment.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fresh clashes were reported in Pigi and Fangak counties on Tuesday. Phom El Zaraf and Tangbwong were attacked. SPLA-IO forces claim many civilians were killed during the attack on Tangbwong. They also claim to have sunk 5 SPLA-Juba boats attacking Phom El Zaraf, reportedly killing at least 100 government soldiers.

column8: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Nuer youth brawled in Bentiu camp. When UN police forces tried to intervene, the youth attacked them with machetes, steel rods and spears. 5 camp residents received injuries.
A man dressed as a police officer shot and killed a Lakes state government official in Malith market in a reported assassination attempt.
4 people were killed by unidentified gunmen in different locations around Kapoeta in Eastern Equatoria. 3 were civilians and 1 was a soldier.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fresh clashes were reported in Pigi and Fangak counties on Tuesday. Phom El Zaraf and Tangbwong were attacked. SPLA-IO forces claim many civilians were killed during the attack on Tangbwong. They also claim to have sunk 5 SPLA-Juba boats attacking Phom El Zaraf, reportedly killing at least 100 government soldiers.
Traders in Bor have locked their shops to protest delays in receiving letters of credit from the government which would give them access to hard currency.

column9: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: South Sudanese security personnel seized trucks transporting armoured vehicles and equipment for Ethiopian peacekeepers serving with UNMISS. They also allegedly beat the drivers of the trucks, accusing them of transporting weapons to the SPLA-IO.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes were reported between SPLA-IO and SPLA-Juba forces near Tor. Boths sides accuse the other of starting the fighting.
The former mayor of Yei and her office manager were found brutally murdered at a construction site just outside Juba. 4 people have been arrested in connection.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces reported clashes near Gerbenna northeast of Renk.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces attacked a SPLA-Juba position in Duk Duk following an artillery barrage. They were defeated and withdrew to Tibol. 5 SPLA-Juba soldiers were killed and 21 wounded, while heavy losses, coded as 10, were reported among the SPLO-IO forces.
""One INGO driver was carjacked and beaten by three armed men. He suffered injuries to his face and arm. The attack occurred in the evening.""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The SPLA-IO chief negotiator announced that SPLA-Juba forces shelled their position in Pham el Zeraf, the administrative capital of Fangak.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes were reported near Bentiu between SPLA-IO and SPLA-Juba forces, but these were not confirmed by the SPLA-IO.

On 12 and 13 Nov 2014, 7 were killed and a number injured during 2 days of bombing over Maban, allegedly carried out by the SAF. Yapta and Kortumbak was among the place hit. (Total of 7 fatalities divided across 2 events.)
People demonstrated in Yei after the killing of an ex-mayor in Juba, demanding the government and security forces do more to prevent disappearances/killings.
""One INGO security guard was shot and wounded by unknown persons while on duty at Batil camp. He sustained serious injuries and was hospitalized.""
""The chairperson of the youth in the area [of Kapoeta]... sustained wounds after being shot at last week.""

On 12 and 13 Nov 2014, 7 were killed and a number injured during 2 days of bombing over Maban, allegedly carried out by the SAF. Yapta and Kortumbak was among the place hit. (Total of 7 fatalities divided across 2 events.)
A journalist was allegedly beaten while being detained by the police.

At least 7 civilians and 3 UN police were injured during fighting between Nuer and Shilluk ethnic groups at Protection of Civilian sites near Malakal. UN police were injured when they tried to separate the fighters.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on police and others in a vehicle on Kapoeta road. One policeman was injured while they were returning returned fire.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The Deputy-Governor of Upper Nile claims SPLM-Juba forces came under attack from artillery fired by SPLM-IO forces.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Presidential Security Unit
column17: Members of the ""presidential guard force"" assaulted and detained a journalist working for Bloomberg.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: According to the Deputy-Governor of Upper Nile clashes occurred around Nasser between SPLM-Juba forces and gunmen suspected to be loyal to SPLM-IO.

The army new recruits took to street in Yambio Western Equatoria State, striking for not being paid for several months and complaining about lack of food. Security forces control the situation. Radio Tamazuj reported looting and damage to cars.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A commander of the SPLA-IO faction has accused SPLA-Juba forces of launching a fresh attack in Fangak County of northern Jonglei State on Wednesday.

Two persons have been shot dead by suspected cattle raiders from neighboring Yirol West County of Lakes State. The incident took place in Lesi Payam. No specific date reported; Nov 26 is date of report.

Five people were wounded when unknown gunmen stormed and opened fire on the house of a journalist in SouthSudans Lakes state in a supposed revenge attack; the journalists family fired back and one of the attackers was found dead.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A commander of the SPLA-IO faction has accused SPLA-Juba forces of launching a fresh attack in Fangak County of northern Jonglei State on Wednesday. Clashes continue on Thursday. The Sudan Tribune reported that Phoem al Zeraf, capital of Fangak, was captured from the rebels by government forces.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Heavy fighting between government and rebel forces broke out in Fangak County late Friday with both sides using heavy artilleries

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: A UN spokesman has said clashes have continued between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces in Fangak since Nov.28.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: On 30 Nov 2014, a UN staff member was assaulted by an INGO security guard in Bunj. The UN staff member was taken to the hospital as a result of the attack.
6 people were kidnapped by the LRA in Ezo county. The 5 men kidnapped were released but the 6th was a woman and is still missing.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: A UN spokesman has said clashes have continued between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces in Fangak since Nov.28.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; South Sudan News Agency
column17: A UN spokesman has said clashes have continued between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces in Fangak since Nov.28.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: A UN spokesman has said clashes have continued between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces in Fangak since Nov.28.
8 well-armed LRA forces reportedly abducted a family of 7 civilians near Ezo, South Sudan, and looted food from the victims. Among the abducted civilians were 4 men, 1 girl and 1 woman.
4 soldiers were killed during a clash with traffic police officers after they refused to stop at a roadblock.

Clashes broke out between the residents of Loroyo and Idali villages in Torit county. 24 people died in total, including 18 women, 2 children and 4 men, during the fighting. Others sustained unspecified injuries.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that they have been engaged in fighting with the government, including shelling of their areas, over the past week from Dec.6-12. They also say they were driven out of the county initially by the shelling, but have recaptured Phom el Zeraf on Dec.12. They claim to have killed 78 government soldiers and captured a variety of weapons and vehicles. The government disputes this account and says no fighting has taken place.

They claim to have killed 78 government soldiers and captured a variety of weapons and vehicles. The government disputes this account and says no fighting has taken place.
4 people were killed in a raid allegedly involving Misseriya militia and Sudanese army personnel on Lou village in Majak county. Most of the villagers are IDPs.
3 people were killed, 4 wounded and 5 are missing after a cattle raid allegedly by Misseriya in Majak county of Abyei.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that they have been engaged in fighting with the government, including shelling of their areas, over the past week from Dec.6-12. They also say they were driven out of the county initially by the shelling, but have recaptured Phom el Zeraf on Dec.12. They claim to have killed 78 government soldiers and captured a variety of weapons and vehicles. The government disputes this account and says no fighting has taken place.
A man killed 5 people and burned down the local chiefs house following a land dispute ruling against him.

2 men were detained by unidentified armed men and were tortured for 2 days. They were questioned about their ethnic affiliations. One of the men was tortured to death while the other was released. The incident was believed to be related to a land dispute with an ethnic group from a neighbouring state.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Sudan Tribune; South Sudan News Agency
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that they have been engaged in fighting with the government, including shelling of their areas, over the past week from Dec.6-12. They also say they were driven out of the county initially by the shelling, but have recaptured Phom el Zeraf on Dec.12. They claim to have killed 78 government soldiers and captured a variety of weapons and vehicles. The government disputes this account and says no fighting has taken place.
3 people were killed and 2 injured when a policeman opened fire in a market. The three killed were Ugandans. It is not clear why the shooting was carried out, but the shooter has since been detained.
3 people were killed and 200 cattle stolen by heavily armed Arab militias, some of whom were dressed in military fatigues and had machine guns. 75 cattle have seen been recovered.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Sudan Tribune; South Sudan News Agency
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that they have been engaged in fighting with the government, including shelling of their areas, over the past week from Dec.6-12. They also say they were driven out of the county initially by the shelling, but have recaptured Phom el Zeraf on Dec.12. They claim to have killed 78 government soldiers and captured a variety of weapons and vehicles. The government disputes this account and says no fighting has taken place.

A police officer opened fire on security forces sent to arrest him at his house before surrendering the next day. He injured one police officer and two soldiers. He was also injured which prompted his surrender.

26 people have died and 62 were confirmed injured in ""inter-clan revenge clashes"" in Cueibet county between Dec.11-12, reportedly between the Pagok and Pathiong clans. The violence allegedly started when it was suspected that a Pagok couple were killed by a Pathiong youth.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces was reported 40 km southeast of Renk.
IDPs at the UN camp in Juba protested targeting Boda Boda drivers. Some people were injured during the protests before UN security forces could intervene and disperse the demonstrators.
Heavy fighting between armed youth and SPLA-Juba forces was reported near Nassir.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Sudan Tribune; South Sudan News Agency
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that they have been engaged in fighting with the government, including shelling of their areas, over the past week from Dec.6-12. They also say they were driven out of the county initially by the shelling, but have recaptured Phom el Zeraf on Dec.12. They claim to have killed 78 government soldiers and captured a variety of weapons and vehicles. The government disputes this account and says no fighting has taken place.

26 people have died and 62 were confirmed injured in ""inter-clan revenge clashes"" in Cueibet county between Dec.11-12, reportedly between the Pagok and Pathiong clans. The violence allegedly started when it was suspected that a Pagok couple were killed by a Pathiong youth.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Arrests: Wau authorities say they have captured three SPLA-IO faction recruiters operating in the area.
In December 2014, a hand grenade killed 3 children in Ajak Kuac Payam, Warrap State. Reports suggest that the grenade was left an unexploded ordinance.
Looting: MSF reported two instances of looting in Malakal. As a result, they shut down their services.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that it defeated reinforcements sent after their attack on the Nimule-Juba roadway, sending it back in ""disarray"" towards the capital and destroying at least one Toyota with a heavy machine-gun mounted on the back. However, the deputy spokesman contradicted earlier claims and has denied that the movement carried out the attack.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The SPLA-IO has said that it has attacked a convoy carrying food from Nimule to Juba and distributed the food not damaged in the attack to the local people in the area. One driver was injured in the attacks and the trucks were destroyed afterwards. However, the deputy spokesman contradicted earlier claims and has denied that the movement carried out the attack.
A mob from Kangi payam killed the paramount chief of Alel Thony payam in a revenge attack.
Hundreds of people rallied on the streets of Bor to demand peace.

At least 3 people were killed after a revenge attack following the killing of the paramount chief of Alel Thony on Dec.19. Youths from both communities were reportedly hunting each other in the forests of the area, causing residents to flee into the bush and neighbouring states.
The SPLA-IO has accused JEM of stealing 470 cattle from civilians in Mayom and killing 3.
At least 2 people were killed when the Thuyiic and Gony clans clashed in Rumbek East. 1 student and 1 pastorlist were killed. The fighting was believed to be a suspected revenge attack.
At least 9 people were killed when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a commercial truck in the Tale area. The cause for the attack was uncertain.
At least 3 people were shot dead in a cattle raid in Mudubai, in Maridi county. A number of livestock were also stolen. 1 person was wounded.
Communal violence was reported in Panawac. Police have also deserted in the Panawac area.

At least 35 people were killed (estimates have been as high as 53) in communal violence between the Gony and Thuyiic clans in Rumbek East county in the areas of Pacong, Panawac and Malek. Police have deserted these areas fearing attacks by armed pastoralists. 156 others have been confirmed wounded, including 4 SPLA soldiers. Kok-Keer and Kok-Awac were also said to have been among the dead and wounded.

At least 35 people were killed (estimates have been as high as 53) in communal violence between the Gony and Thuyiic clans in Rumbek East county in the areas of Pacong, Panawac and Malek. Police have deserted these areas fearing attacks by armed pastoralists. 156 others have been confirmed wounded, including 4 SPLA soldiers. Kok-Keer and Kok-Awac were also said to have been among the dead and wounded.
The director of security in Mundri West was killed, and 2 other bodies were found after shootings in the evening in Mundri. 4 civilians were also injured.
At least 10 IDPs were killed as they attempted to flee to Sudan from Bentiu

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An SPLA-Juba spokesman has said that 1 officer was killed and 2 soldiers injured during an SPLA-IO artillery bombardment in Nasir town.

On 29 December 2014, 5 were injured in a brawl in Nimule (Eastern Equatoria state) between members of the Ayual sub-section of the Lith Twic East section and the Juet sub-section of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka. The brawl broke out after several young Juet women were attacked by Ayual youths.

column9: Women (South Sudan); Bor Clan Group (South Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column17: On 29 December 2014, youths from the Ayual sub-section of the Lith section of the Twic East Dinka attacked young women from the Juet sub-section of the Athoc Bor Dinka clan at Nimule (Eastern Equatoria state). There is no further information.
A member of the SPLA-IO has accused the government of killing 2 of his young relatives, who were arrested by government forces, after their bodies were found in the Rubkona area.
The Bahr al Ghazal Minister of Information has claimed that the SAF has bombed Deim Jallab in the Raja area, killing at least 2 and wounding at least 16.
A man was lynched by a mob for allegedly murdering a child and wounding 3 other children.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Recruitment: SPLM-IO reportedly recruiting in Western Bahr el Ghazal.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.
