column17: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba forces said that SPLA-IO forces shelled their position near the Unity oil fields in the morning.
Director of security services in Mundri West was shot dead in Mundri in early January.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO and SPLA-Juba forces clashed near the Unity oil fields, north of Bentiu. An SPLA-Juba spokesman said that rebel forces attacked their position. 2 SPLA-Juba soldiers were killed in the attack.
A cattle thief was killed during clashes with a joint security force along the Tore-Maridi border.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The SPLA-IO reportedly attacked SPLA-Juba forces on the southwest side of Bentiu. The attack was repulsed. The SPLA-IO claims it lost more than 20 soldiers with 30 wounded, while claiming that they inflicted heavy losses on the government (coded as 10).

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The SPLA-IO claims that they clashed with SPLA-Juba forces on the Guit and Nhialdiu roads near Bentiu.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The SPLA-IO claims that they clashed with SPLA-Juba forces on the Guit and Nhialdiu roads near Bentiu.

""A local driver for an INGO was assaulted by two SPLA soldiers when stopped at a roundabout while driving in Agok. The soldiers, who had stopped behind him in their own vehicle, forced him out of his car. UNISFA soldiers intervened to stop the attack.""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes were reported in and about Nasir between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Eye Radio (South Sudan)
column17: Clashes were reported in Maban between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces Jan.8-9. An SPLA-IO spokesman said they torched an SPLM-N military training centre in the area before clashing with the SPLA-Juba and inflicted heavy casualties, as well as injuring at least 1 officer, before pulling out of the area. 2 SPLA-IO fighterss sustained minor injuries. 5 civilians were also reportedly killed during the attack by SPLA-IO forces, and at least 4 young women were abducted. An SPLA-IO spokesman denied the abductions.

A former Unity state official has claimed he survived an assassination attempt for his critical views by security forces personnel acting on the orders of the Unity state governor. The men ransacked the former officials residence and kidnapped him to the bush where he was able to escape.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudan Tribune
column17: Clashes were reported in Maban between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces Jan.8-9. An SPLA-IO spokesman said they torched an SPLM-N military training centre in the area before clashing with the SPLA-Juba and inflicted heavy casualties, as well as injuring at least 1 officer, before pulling out of the area. 2 SPLA-IO fighterss sustained minor injuries. 5 civilians were also reportedly killed during the attack by SPLA-IO forces, and at least 4 young women were abducted. An SPLA-IO spokesman denied the abductions.

The caretaker governor of Lakes state was ambushed by unidentified gunmen who fired on his convoy. His bodyguards fought them off using weapons seized by the attackers. 1 of the attackers was taken captive, and no casualties were reported.

8 people were killed in a revenge attack by Pagoor youth on Tieptiep payam in Cueibet county, allegedly due to the release of a Tieptiep clan member who killed one of the Pagoor community. 2 others were injured, including the paramount chief.
Bor county commissioner claimed that Murle tribesmen raided Pawuoi cattle camp in Nyuak Payam of East Twic County, killing 2 and wounding others in the attack.

Youth from Rajaf Payam, near Juba, armed with traditional weapons clashed with SPLA-Juba soldiers whom they accused of selling off community land in the area, resulting in youth wounded. The officer who wounded the youth has been detained by police.
1 woman was shot and wounded, and died on her way to hospital, after unidentified gunmen attacked her and her friends while they were collecting firewood outside of Chukudum town.
Armed gunmen attacked a village near the Lakes State Legislative Assembly, 1km outside Rumbek town. 1 person was killed and 3 were injured, 1 seriously. Some of the attackers wore police uniforms.

column7: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Recruitment: HRW reported a January spike in incidents of child soldier recruitment in and around Malakal by both rebel and military forces (especially those led by former militia leader Johnson Olony).
Change to armed group: In early January, 30 Nuer soldiers deserted from the military forces at Boro Medina and Raga town.

At least one SPLA soldier was killed and another one wounded in a shooting targeting two SPLA vehicles on the road between Raja and Boro Medina in Western Bahr el Ghazal State. LRA accused of the attack.
4 fishermen killed in Dolo area (coordinates unavailable), Raja county.

Unidentified armed forces ambushed 2 security forces vehicles on the Raga-Boro Medina axis, S. Sudan. One security force died and another was wounded in the ensuing fire exchange. The assailants then reportedly set fire to the vehicles.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked Gendrasa in Maban County in January. 4 women and girls abducted.
Hundreds of citizens of Wau have protested against the conflict in the country, demanding peace.

column9: Civilians (South Sudan); Government of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Culture, Youth, and Sports Minister Gatluak Liephoth Dieu was attacked and beaten in the UN base on Jan. 17. Gatluaks bodyguard and a woman who tried to disperse the fight were also hurt.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: A major attack has been reported by SPLA-IO forces against SPLA-Juba position in Umdhurich, northeast of Renk. No casualty figures have yet been reported.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO and Gai Gatluak accuse government forces in Renk of shelling in Bushar, Musekbel, Gabat and Dongos. Rebels claim to have pushed government forces back to their positions.
At least 11 civilians killed over 3 days (Jan 18-20) of attacks and cattle raids on the Bari village of Kworiji-Luri, north of Juba. Attack allegedly carried out by 50 members of the Mundari tribe.
Unknown gunmen in three vehicles pulled up to the Motherland Hotel in Nimule Payam in Eastern Equatoria state and opened fire, killing 2 members of the Madi ethnic group.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels loyal to Machar clashed with military forces in the Maper area of Rumbek. County headquarters was attacked, several homes burned. At least 10 civilians killed and 24 wounded.
At least 11 civilians killed over 3 days (Jan 18-20) of attacks and cattle raids on the Bari village of Kworiji-Luri, north of Juba. Attack allegedly carried out by 50 members of the Mundari tribe.
At least 7 people killed following an attack on Mantio village, allegedly carried out by fighters from neighbouring Mayendit in Unity state.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting ensued after SPLA/M-IO accused of setting fire to government-controlled oil installations in Pariang. 7 casualties over first 3 days of fighting.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO and government forces continued fighting after SPLA/M-IO accused of setting fire to oil installations in Pariang on Jan 19.
At least 11 civilians killed over 3 days (Jan 18-20) of attacks and cattle raids on the Bari village of Kworiji-Luri, north of Juba. Attack allegedly carried out by 50 members of the Mundari tribe.

Hundreds protested in Juba following the attack on civilians in Kworijin village. Many protesters were from the Bari community. Police accused 2 journalists of being spies, and beat and arrested the journalists.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled Renk on Jan. 21.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO and government forces continued fighting after SPLA/M-IO accused of setting fire to oil installations in Pariang on Jan 19.
One fishermen shot dead and another injured by suspected LRA along the road between Raja to Deim Zubeir and Wau in Dangush village near Sopo area.

column7: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
column17: Hundreds of Dinka Bor women took to the streets in Jongeli state capital Bor, calling on the governor to resign.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: South Sudanese army forces reportedly abandoned on Friday their defence positions following sustained sustained attacks from rebels in Darkuach area (coordinates unavailable) of Unity state. Government forces were no longer in control of the area, but are still stationed within the vicinity of the Pariang oil facility.
Women from Dinka counties of Bor, Twic East and Duk protested to accuse the states Caretaker Governor John Kong Nyuon of supporting rebels. 5 arrested.
13 people killed, including 5 journalists for South Sudan state-run media, when suspected LRA opened fire on a 2-car convoy driving through Kubri Modabal, Raja county.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked and looted Imtidad market, northeast of Renk.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked the headquarters of the government battalion in Halka (coordinates unavailable), north of Renk.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Rebels shelled Bentiu. 2 killed.

280 child soldiers recruited by the South Sudan Democratic Army (SSDA) Cobra Faction led by David Yau Yau, were released in Gumuruk coordinates unavailable) in Jonglei state. Another 300 were released two weeks later on 10 February, and another 600 soon after, on 20 February.

column6: REMNASA: Revolutionary Movement for National Salvation
column17: A new rebel movement named the Revolutionary Movement for National Salvation (REMNASA) attacked security forces in Maridi on Jan. 27. 6 soldiers killed and many wounded. The attack marked the official launch of the rebel movement led by Lasuba Lodoru Wongon.
Arrests: Military leadership arrested senior commander Col. Achuil Mathiang Kiirnaar in Juba, allegedly for failing to hold defensive positions in recent fighting with SPLA-IO in Pariang.

Rioters closed a bridge connecting Western Bahr El Ghaza to Warrap state at Tharkueng area (coordinates unavailable). Protest in response to the Kuac South Payam community of Warrap for removing the flag of Western Bahr El Ghazal which was mounted at Dong, an area the community claimed to be inside Warrap state territory. One medical assistant shot.
Movement of forces: Military and police forces deployed in Northern Bahr al Ghazal States capital city Aweil amid high political tension following the resolution to impeach Governor Kuel Aguer.
5 injured in clashes in Ayenic, Awerial County between youth from Rorapuk and Kochmaboor. 3 arrested.

2 killed in clashes between displaced and host communities in Gendrasa camp in Maban County. Clashes began after four Blue Nile refugees killed a local farmer, prompting the farmers family to kill a refugee in retaliation.
SPLA-Juba allegedly attacked civilians south of Mayom.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government forces attacked SPLA/M-IO rebel bases in Wiechok and Buoth areas near Mayom.
Continued clashes between displaced and host communities in Gendrasa camp in Maban County. 6 injured.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Intergovernmental Authority on Development; Radio Dabanga
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Bentiu.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Health Workers (South Sudan)
column17: Looting: Between 22 January-21 February, following clashes in the Kajo-Keji area, extensive vandalism and looting of vacated houses, shops, church compounds, NGO compounds (notably the American Refugee Committee's) and of the hospital has been reportedly carried out by unknown assailants, leaving the area deprived of basic services.
A 16-year-old boy was abducted near Tambura, South Sudan as he was on his way to buy some fish.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Intergovernmental Authority on Development; Radio Dabanga
column17: During a second day of fighting with the army, SPLA/M-IO fired rockets into Bentiu, killing two civilians.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Hundreds of unidentified armed men attacked Jalle Payam in Bor County. Houses burnt, thousands of cattle stolen, and children abducted. 5 killed, 7 wounded. Army and police units were dispatched to the area the following day.
Cattle raiders from Pibor attacked villages of Pager and Lualdiit near Twic East.
Youth rioters broke into the stores of the WFP in Deim Zoubeir and stole bags of dry food after they protested about the rations they were receiving.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column7: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Military intelligence and NSS agents detained 4 men in and around Nimule, 2 men were beaten during their detention due to their alleged connection with Martin Kenyi, a senior army officer who defected to Machar in 2014.
5 fishermen killed by unknown gunmen in a fishing camp in Tonj North County on Feb 3.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); WFP: World Food Programme
column17: SPLA/M-IO rebels in Jiech Payam, Ayod County detained a WFP helicopter that was bringing food to Uror and supposedly illegally landed in Jiech. Rebels forcefully removed Chol Aruai (National Bureau of Statistics), Mading Akueth (Lutheran World Federation), and Jacob Alier (WFP), all allegedly targeted because of their Dinka ethnicity. All the abductees were released in Juba on Feb 5.
Clashes between Rup and Keui tribes sparked after a staff member of the State Ministry of Information was killed in his house. 6 killed.
A gunmen killed a man in Pankar village. The man was from the Amonthnhom clan of the Kuei section.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled a military camp in Rankai area in Mayom town.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled military positions in Nasir.

On 9 February 2015, clashes between Habbaniyah and Rizaygat tribes in Bahr Al Arab, after Habbaniyah tribesmen stole 57 cows and 4 camels from a Rizaygat owner. Rizeigat then formed a team to pursue the thieves. 2 Habbaniyah men killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO rebel attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled Malakal area on Feb. 10.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO rebel attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO forces shelled Bentiu on Feb. 10.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled Nasir on Feb. 10.
Residents of Hai Sherikat in Gumbo protested after the Central Equatoria state government moved to demolish their houses. Police fired shots to disperse the crowd. Several people arrested.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Intergovernmental Authority on Development; Radio Dabanga
column17: SPLA/M-IO fired two rockets at an army supply flight as it landed at an airstrip in Nasir.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO rebel attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.
Unknown person threw a hand grenade at a supermarket in Bor. 3 traders from Ethiopia injured.

column16: Radio Dabanga; Intergovernmental Authority on Development
column17: Property destruction: Military set fire to hospital buildings and a WFP food store in Nasir. No casualties reported.
Unknown gunmen shot three bullets into the leg of National Parliament member Joseph Ngere Paciko in Mundri West.

column6: SSDA-Cobra: South Sudan Democratic Army (Cobra Faction)
column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Change to armed group: On Feb 12, a splinter group of the Cobra forces of Greater Pibor Area of Murle ethnic group announced its defection from government forces and declared allegiance to Machar's rebels.
Gunmen killed Anuak tribal leader Ujulu Oman in Pochalla County in Konglei. 2 children were abducted in Pochalla the same day.
""An INGO worker was reportedly raped by a UN contractor. The incident occurred in Bentiu, South Sudan on the UN compound.""
Two pastors from the St Andrews church in Bor were killed in a road ambush laid by unknown gunmen along the Juba-Bor road in February 2015.
Johnson Olonyis rebel group forcibly abducted hundreds of schoolboys (originally reported as at least 89 abducted) and 6 teachers that were preparing for exams in Wau Shilluk on Feb 15 and 16.

Unidientified group forcibly abducted 89 schoolboys and 6 teachers that were preparing for exams in Wau Shilluk on Feb 16 and 17. UNICEF stated that the area is controlled by Gen Olonys government-allied Shilluk militia, but had no verifiable evidence of which group committed the abductions.
6 Murle tribesman attacked citizens from Makuac Payam in Tibek. 1 killed and others wounded.

Clashes between groups in Kella Payam near Torit, when women from Terongore went to fish and were shot by youth from Muratika. Youth from Muratika claimed that youths from Terongore raided their cattle. 4 people wounded.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military Feb 16 in Kaka. Local authorities in Manyo County refuted SPLA/Ms claims that rebels overtook the area. Several rebels killed, 10 soldiers injured.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Renk area on Feb 16. At least 14 wounded.
A British aid worker (Carter Center) was shot dead when a gunmen followed him into his compound in Juba on Feb 17. 4 arrested.
""""A British aid worker was shot in his car by someone in a secondary vehicle that had pulled up behind him while he was returning to the organizational compound.""""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Fashoda County on Feb 17. SPLA/M-IO claimed to have captured Haluf near Kaka, but local Manyo authorities stated that the rebels withdrew from Haluf. Several government soldiers killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M and military in Renk area on Feb 17.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Kaka and Adoudi, Malut area on Feb 18. 80 soldiers injured and 50 disappeared. 6 soldiers killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Renk area on Feb 18.

Change to armed group: Senior official of SPLA/M-IO Brig Lul Ruai Koang announced his defection from Machars forces and the formation of his own faction with membership of the Lou-Nuer White Army. The new rebel group is known as the South Sudan Resistance Movement/Army (SSRM/A). The main objective of the group is to establish a separate state for Greater Akobo counties of Lou Nuer. Officials in greater Akobo counties have dismissed claims of Lou Nuers White Army defection, stating that the whole Lou Nuer territory and forces remain under the leadership of Machar.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Intergovernmental Authority on Development; Radio Dabanga
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled government-held areas of Dukduk.
Unknown gunmen killed 2 in Anyiel Village, Twic County, Warrap state (coordinates for Warrap state capital Kuajok are used). 2 arrested.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column7: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Military intelligence and NSS agents detained and beat two men in Nimule while asking about Martin Kenyi, a senior army officer who defected to Machar in 2014.

Clashes between locals, soldiers, and police after a bar owner attacked an SPLA-Juba soldier with a knife in Owiny Ki-bul. In retaliation, soldiers beat people, looted and burned houses in the village and market. 30 wounded, 1 soldier killed. 3 soldiers injured by stray bullets fired by police.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Around 80 boys 13 to 14 years old forcibly recruited by SPLA/M-IO soldiers in Leer.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Mass recruitment of child soldiers by SPLA/M-IO in Panyijar.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Reports of clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Unity State.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Reports of clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Nasir.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column7: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Military intelligence detained and beat a man near Nimule, asking him about Martin Kenyi, a senior army officer who defected to Machar in 2014.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Armed clashes between herders from Jonglei state and Mundari cattle keepers in Lainya County and along Yei-Juba road. 12 dead over 2 days of fighting, including a soldier who was heading to Juba. Police forces were sent to the area.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army forces in Tom South, Pariang County. No casualties reported.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Armed clashes between herders from Jonglei state and Mundari cattle keepers, began in Lainya County and along the Yei-Juba road. 12 dead over 2 days of fighting, including a soldier who was heading to Juba. Police forces were sent to the area.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled Renk, hitting homes and a stadium in Al Sarayat neighborhood.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Hundreds of men and boys were forcibly recruited by SPLA/M-IO in Old Fangak.
Cattle raiders attacked Ngap cattle camp in Rumbek. 5 killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Ayod County.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked Bugaya area of Maban County the week of March 2. Burned a heathcare center.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shelled government-controlled areas of Nasir.

Police in Wau staged a strike in protest of unpaid wages for January and February. Rioters blocked the main roads and locked several police officers in their offices and then fired gunshots in the air. Military were dispatched, leading to an exchange of fire between police and military. 4 or 5 people killed by stray bullets. Military began to withdraw from Wau on March 4.

Clashes between LRA and South Sudanese military in Nabiapai Boma, along the border with Democratic Republic of Congo. 1 LRA and 1 soldier killed. Clashes took place soon after 13 people were abducted by LRA near the border.
LRA abducts 13 boys in Nabiapai Boma, near border with Democratic Republic of Congo. 9 abductees were later released soon after capture.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked military in Raja County.

As military soldiers withdrew from Wau following riots and clashes between police and military on March 2, they beat a policeman and put him in a vehicle driving towards the military garrision. The man was later returned to Wau Civil Hospital where he died. Police believe that 70 police personnel are being held at the military garrison in Grinti.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked military in Sere Malaga area along the border with the disputed Kafia Kinji area in Western Bahr el Ghazal. Soldiers captured 4 rebels and some weapons.
Government supporters demonstrated against planned UN sanctions in the country.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Duk Duk area of Renk.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Renk over the weekend of March 7-8.
4 teenagers died in Agok in Abyei area when a grenade they found detonated.

column7: Cobras Militia; Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Presidential Security Unit
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military overtakes Wadakona near Renk after clashes with SPLA/M-IO. Presidential guard (Tiger Division) and Cobra militia also involved in the fighting.
Suspected Murle militia attacked Bor and abducted 2 children. 2 people also wounded.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Manyo County, on the opposite bank of the Nile from Renk city (coordinates for Upper Nile State capital of Malakal used). Clashes reported in Kwaik, Khor Neem, and Hamra.
Dinka cattle raiders attacked the Dinka village of Bangolo Payam near Mundri. At least 7 killed, 2 injured, and over 500 cows taken.
Women's groups in Maridi County gathered at Maridi Freedom Square fasting and praying for peace in South Sudan, following stalled peace talks in Addis Ababa last week.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Manyo Countys northern payams near Wadakona from Mar. 11-13.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Manyo Countys northern payams near Wadakona from Mar. 11-13.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Civilians (International); Aid Workers (International)
column17: ""One INGO international aid worker and one national staff person were injured when their car was carjacked by a group of armed men. The aid worker was returning to his compound when the attack occurred at the gate of the compound. As the armed men were fleeing in the vehicle they stole, they indiscrimantly shot rounds at the compound, hitting the INGO worker in the leg and the driver in the neck, both who have received medical attention for their wounds and will recover.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Manyo Countys northern payams near Wadakona. On Mar. 13, SPLA/M-IO bombed a tank and a government ferry, alledging that the army was transporting UPDF and Funj militias to fight in Wadakona following the governments reclaiming of the town the previous week.
Military soldiers shot at least 2 people dead in a restaurant in Paloich area, due to a dispute over an unpaid bill.

A suspected policeman ambushed an unknown group on their way to Torit. Ambush occurred near Labalua Hill. Group leader was armed, and when shot dead, another man reportedly picked up the gun and was also shot dead.
A policeman exchanged fire with wildlife soldiers in Torit. No casualties reported.

column9: Kuei Ethnic Militia (South Sudan); Dinka Nyang Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Clashes between Pakam and Rup militias, backed by Kuei and Nyang militias, in Bulbar cattle camp near Rumbek. Fighting continued for 9 hours. 90 dead. Dozens missing.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""A UN contracted truck traveling as part of a convoy was ambushed on Pariang road. The truck was burnt and the driver of the truck is missing.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in areas near Wadakona. 2 soldiers of Nuer ethnicity captured.

column8: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: Unknown tribal militia attacked Maryal village, southeast of the Sudan and South Sudan disputed area of Abyei. UNISFA was forced to retreat. 3 killed, 8 abducted, 1700 displaced.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army between Kuek and Musabbal (Masegbel). SPLA/M-IO captured Musabbal (Masegbel).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO clashes with army. On Mar. 15, SPLA/M-IO captured village of Gabat, east of Manyo County in Upper Nile State (coordinates for Upper Nile State capital Malakal used). 144 killed over two days of fighting (72 fatalities coded per day).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Mangok.
Clashes between Pakam and Rup militia in Korado, Rumbek Central. 5 dead.

column6: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Bor Dinka militia raided a Mundari cattle camp and killed several people.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO clashes with army. Government regained controlled of Gabat, east of Manyo County (coordinates for Upper Nile State capital Malakal used), which SPLA/M-IO had captured on March 15. Rebels left behind a T-55 tank. 144 killed over two days of fighting (72 fatalities coded per day).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO ambushed a government vehicle in Rubkona.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO ambush military forces in Nyabol Kabur, Unity State. 10km north of a UN compound. 13 government soldiers killed. 9 soldiers seriously injured. 4 army vehicles set on fire.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Xinhua; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo)
column17: Military shelling of SPLA/M-IO in the vicinity of UNMISS base in Renk.

Citizens of Pibor Administrative Area held a demonstration protesting against the suspension of construction work on the Juba-Pibro road. Construction haulted over fears that it may have a negative impact on wildlife in Bardigilo National Park.
7 killed and one injured when a container full of munitions exploded near Thar Jath. Explosives were left over from clashes between government forces and rebels in 2014.
Businessmen in Aweil protested the increase in robberies in the market.

Unidentified armed men reportedly attacked 2 couples east of Gangura, South Sudan. The assailants killed the 2 men, and the 2 women managed to escape. According to the source, the 2 men were Ugandans who came to Gangura, South Sudan, to fetch wood.
250 child soldiers recruited by the South Sudan Democratic Army (SSDA) Cobra Faction led by David Yau Yau, were released in Jonglei State over three days (Mar 21-23).

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Wang Kai.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column7: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Military intelligence detained and beat a man in Nimule market, asking him about Martin Kenyi, a senior army officer who defected to Machar in 2014.
A local Mundari chief reported clashes between Mundari and Dinka herders in Terekeka County. Military were deployed to the area. 2 civilians killed.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Prison Guards
column17: Prison guards at Kapoeta North jail (coordinates for Kapoeta North capital Riwoto used) opened fire and killed 7 prisoners, wounding 4 others, when prisoners rioted over lack of food. Prisoners broke windows and doors and attacked prison guards. The prison officer in charge and 37 others were wounded.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military clashes with SPLA/M-IO east of Gwit, 20km from Bentiu. 15 soldiers and rebels killed in clashes near Gwit on Mar. 23 (8 fatalities coded) and clashes near Nhialdiu on Mar 24 (7 fatalities coded).
Rapes reported throughout the week of March 23 in Owiny Ki-bul Bome, Magwi County.
Military general shot dead in Aweil South County.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO launched mortar shells in Bentiu.
SAF dropped 17 bombs at Deliba area in Raja County. 1 killed, 5 wounded.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in and around Rubkona.
TV presenter Michael Christopher supposedly abducted by elements of the military, after he was summoned to the military intelligence headquarters in Giyada in Juba.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO near Nhialdiu. 15 rebels and soldiers killed in clashes near Gwit on Mar. 23 (8 fatalities coded) and clashes near Nhialdiu on Mar 24 (7 fatalities coded).
A police officer was shot dead in Munuki area of Juba while riding a motorcycle to work. 1 suspect arrested.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO between Khor-Athuoy and Wadakona. 10 soldiers killed, 6 captured.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Ayod. 154 soldiers killed over three days (52 fatalities coded for Mar. 25. 51 fatalities for Mar. 26. 51 fatalities for Mar. 27).

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Ayod. 154 soldiers killed over three days (52 fatalities coded for Mar. 25. 51 fatalities for Mar. 26. 51 fatalities for Mar. 27).
4 soldiers and 1 civilian killed after their military truck was ambushed between Gumuruk and Pibor. No confirmation of which group was behind the attack, although SPLA/M-IO is suspected.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO with Local Defence Force in Ayod. SPLA/M-IO capture Ayod. 154 soldiers killed over three days (52 fatalities coded for Mar. 25. 51 fatalities for Mar. 26. 51 fatalities for Mar. 27).

column9: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Anuak Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Mundari Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column17: 9 killed and others missing when suspected Mundari gunmen attacked a boat traveling between Terekeka and Gemeza. Among those killed are 5 men from Dinka Bor, one from Anuak and two from Mundari ethnic groups.
Clashes between two armed groups inside displaced persons camp in Bentiu. 10 injured by a grenade explosion during the fighting.
A group of cattle keepers attacked and burned Jopa village in Juba County. 1 person killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); WFP: World Food Programme
column17: WFP driver of Somali origin abducted by SPLA/M-IO forces along Mayom-Bentiu road while bringing food to displaced people. Rebels claimed the driver was transporting armed soldiers.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Panyikang County. 2 soldiers killed and 5 wounded. Dozens of rebels killed.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Peoples Liberation Party interim president Peter Mayen Majongdit arrested from home in Juba and severely beaten. Released Apr 8.
Clashes between Shilluk and Dinka ethnic militia in Upper Nile State.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""A UN contracted truck was commandered by the SPLA in Khor Adar with demands to transport troops to Akoka. The location of the truck, two staff members and a contracted driver is unknown, but they were on-route to a relief distribution site in Melut with supplies when intercommunal fighting occurred along the road. Update (August 24, 2015): The organization made a statement confirming that the staff members have been presumed dead.""

At least 13 soldiers killed, including senior government commander James Bugo, in an ambush by the White Army in Abanim area on the road between Malakal and Akoka. Military had been dispatched to respond to clashes between Shilluk and Dinka tribesmen. 3 WFP employees disappeared during the clashes.
2 people killed and 6 wounded by armed group in an attack on Rumbek Center County.
Clashes between Agok and Apuk militia in Guar cattle camp, 50 miles north of Lietnhom in Gorgial East, Warrap State. At least 2 killed, three injured.

Pamker and Pan-Nyang cattle camps in Rumbrek North County (coordinates for Lakes State capital Rumbrek used) attacked by Nuer militia. 24 youth from Rumbrek North killed, 65 sustained gunshot wounds. Rumbrek youth fought back and killed 132 Nuer militiamen.
""One INGO national staff member was shot in the Kassengor area along the border of Eastern Equatoria and Jonglei.""
A Rumbrek Central county policemen opened fire on his colleagues, killing 5, before being shot and killed by another policeman.
Clashes between White Army and Mathiang Anyoor at Abanim area between Fashoda and Akoka (Akoke) Counties.
Shelling between Dinka Akok and military in Lul area in Upper Niles Fashoda County and in Abanim area between Fashoda and Akoka counties. At least two people killed and a child wounded.

column6: SPLM-DC: Sudan People's Liberation Movement (Democratic Change)
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Change to armed group: Diing Garang Diing, head of SPLM-DC office in Aweil, as well as 200 armed youth from Northern Bahr el Ghazal, declared defection and joined SPLM-IO.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Suspected SPLA/M-IO kill two people at the Joda checkpoint on the border of Upper Nile (South Sudan) and White Nile (Sudan) states. Coordinates for Upper Nile capital Malakal used. Checkpoint closed.
Refugees protested against elections in Maban County.
SAF dropped 24 bombs on Deleiba Payam in Raga County. No casualties reported.

column6: REMNASA: Revolutionary Movement for National Salvation
column17: REMNASA attacked military convoy between Maridi and Mambe towns. Maridi county commissioner confirmed the attack but claimed that commercial vehicles were targeted.

column6: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Mechanised military division soldier (and a Murle tribesman) clashed with armed Dinka youth of Kolnyang at Malou village, 30km south of Bor, during an attempted cattle raid. He was later handed over to the military.
Grenade exploded in the hands of a young boy in Turalei County, Warrap State. The boy suffered injuries to his chest, neck, mouth and severed fingers.
Clashes between communities in Minkamman over a disputed ruling made by a traditional court. 27 injured and taken to the hospital.
SAF dropped bombs in Mayom Angok, Akuk-Rial and Nyinboli in Northern Bahr el Ghazal. 4 killed over Apr 8-9, including 2 children (2 fatalities coded for Apr 8, and 2 for Apr 9).
SAF bombed Deleiba Payam in Raga County for second day in a row. No casualties reported.
SAF dropped bombs in Mayom Angok, Akuk-Rial and Nyinboli in Northern Bahr el Ghazal. 4 killed over Apr 8-9, including 2 children (2 fatalities coded for Apr 8, and 2 for Apr 9).

column8: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Shootout between a soldier and two National Security members in Hai Maya on Kokora Road, Juba. All 3 killed.
At least two soldiers killed and 3 wounded in an attack by Dinka Aguok militia in Hai Jalaba, Malakal.
Unknown gunmen shot and killed 2 Sudanese traders - one a Darfur chief - in Gudele West area in Juba.
Bul Nuer militia shoot unknown number of civilians dead in Mading.

column6: SSNLM: South Sudan National Liberation Movement
column17: During the month of April 2015; SSNLM forces abducted two teenage sisters at an unspecified village in Yambio county close to the DRC border (Western Equatoria state, coordinates for Birisi used at prec2). The girls were repeatedly raped and compelled to undertake spying and porterage duties, and were released in February 2018 under a peace deal.
Bul Nuer militia rape women in Jak.
In April, Bul Nuer militia abduct and rape women and girls from Ngop near Rubkona.
Bul Nuer militia shoot at least 2 men dead and injure 1.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Agreement: Shilluk militia known as Collo in Upper Nile state announce defection from SPLA/M-IO and renewed support for military forces.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO clash with military in Khor-Athlo (coordinates for Upper Nile state capital Malakal used).
Soldier shot and injured a policeman at Maroi market in Bor.

column9: CRS: Catholic Relief Service; Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: A food aid convoy was attacked near Poktak. 1 killed and another injured.
Soldiers abduct and torture a priest, beat two of his relatives, and demolish the priests house in Juba.
Unknown group threw a grenade into a night club in Torit. 6 killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Agreement: Over 149 SPLA/M-IO members surrendered in Gahbat area in Upper Nile State, accepting a presidential offer of amnesty.
Clashes between Governor Simon Kun Puochs bodyguards and forces loyal to Gen. Johnson Olonyi, in Hai Jellaba neighbourhood of Malakal. Governors residence was attacked 2 killed and 2 wounded.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between army and SPLA/M-IO in Jilshal area near Sobat River. 28 rebels killed.
Clashes between Chieng Majoak and Chieng Tot subclans of Lou Nuer militia in Akobo. 2 killed. Army deployed to the area.

column7: Abu Shouk Ethnic Militia (South Sudan); White Army (South Sudan); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Clashes between army supported by Abu Shouk - a Dinka ethnic militia - and the White Army versus forces loyal to Olonyi supported by Shilluk militia, in Hai Al Saha, Hai Salam, and Hai Jellaba in Malakal. Dozens killed, including at least 4 civilians. Clashes sparked by shooting incident between Governor Simon Kun Puocs bodyguards and Olonyi troops the night before.
Olonyi troops shelled Malakal.
Heavy gun battles between Olonyi troops and army in Malakal.
Agreement: 282 child soldiers of the Yau Yaus Cobra faction released in Labrab, Jonglei state.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Kaljak, Kuergueyni, and Dhorbor, near Rubkona.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Laloba, Tom South and Khatel Nar areas of Pariang County. Rebels claim to have killed over 125 soldiers over two days of fighting (63 fatalities coded for Apr 26, 62 for Apr 27).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Uchok, Mayom County.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Bul Nuer allied militia and SPLA/M-IO in Nhialdiu, Gwit, Panakauc and Tor areas in Unity state. Unknown number of soldiers and civilians killed over over 2 days of fighting (5 coded for Apr 26, 5 for Apr 27).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Bul Nuer allied militia and SPLA/M-IO in Nhialdiu, Gwit, Panakauc and Tor areas in Unity state. Unknown number of soldiers and civilians killed over over 2 days of fighting (5 coded for Apr 26, 5 for Apr 27).
Unknown group killed a member of the Konakuang clan in Duaj area of Cueibet county.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Umm Dulouth in the northern area of Renk.
Military crossing from Akoka county towards Malakal ambushed on the road by Olonyi rebels.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Dukduk area of Renk.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO within 5kms north and south of Bentiu.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Laloba, Tom South and Khatel Nar areas of Pariang County. Rebels claim to have killed over 125 soldiers over two days of fighting (63 fatalities coded for Apr 26, 62 for Apr 27).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Uchok, Mayom County. Military reclaimed Mayom County.

column7: JEM: Justice and Equality Movement; SPLM-N: Sudan People's Liberation Movement (North)
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military - supported by JEM from Darfur and SPLM-N - vs. SPLA/M-IO in Wichchiok, Tuarkiel and Dhorboor areas of Unity State.

Pro-government Bul Nuer miltiia allegedly raped and abduct women after military failed to retake Kuergueyni, Chotchuru, Nyaromne, Rubnyagai, Dhorbor areas of Robkona County. 30 Civilians targeted in attacks in Thaknyal, Waak, Tongedool, Tuarkiel and Kotchiengdut.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Renk.
Konakuang militia kill 2 members of the Konakuang clan.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Rubkona County. Civilians targeted in attacks IN Thaknyal, Waak, Tongedool, Tuarkiel and Kotchiengdut (coded separately).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Rubkona County. Civilians targeted in attacks IN Thaknyal, Waak, Tongedool, Tuarkiel and Kotchiengdut (coded separately).

Pro-government Bul Nuer miltiia allegedly raped and abduct women after military failed to retake Kuergueyni, Chotchuru, Nyaromne, Rubnyagai, Dhorbor areas of Robkona County. 30 Civilians targeted in attacks in Thaknyal, Waak, Tongedool, Tuarkiel and Kotchiengdut. UPDATED to add Bul Nuer militia.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Renk. Military repulsed attacks and pursued rebels into areas near the Sudanese border.

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column17: South Sudans Military Intelligence detained and mistreated a Sudanese embassy employee in Juba. He was released on May 12.
A soldier who approached a UN protection-of-civilians site in Malakal and opened fire was disarmed and beaten to death by displaced people.
Cattle raiders attacked four cattle camps between Twic County and Gogrial East. 2 killed.
Cattle radiers from Tonj East crossed into Lakes state and attacked Maluell village. At least 5 killed.
Clash between police/military vs. cattle raiders between Kotobi and Bari, 7 miles from Mundri. 5 killed, including a soldier.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Gwit County.
At least 2 killed, 8 wounded at Agok market when soldier detonated a hand grenade.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Tom South payam, Pariang County.
Unknown gunmen kills civilian in Rumbek.
Unknown gunmen kills policeman in Rumbek.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Panakuach in northern Unity State (capital Bentiu coordinates used).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Tem area, 12km north of Ayod.
Soldiers and Bul Nuer allied militia beat and killed several civilians in Gwit. Some women raped.

Police abducted a Sudanese refugee in front of the mosque in Yusuf Batil camp in Upper Nile, South Sudan, tortured him and kept him detained in a container without ventilation in Bunj. The man later died.
Soldiers and militia attack Chatchara village near Bentiu, beating civilians with sticks and metal rods. Several civilians killed and abducted.

column7: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Clashes between Bul Nuer and Haak Nuer in PoC1 camp in Juba. Clashes began when a Bul refused to marry an impregnated Haak girl. UNMISS and police intervened to contain violence. 60 injured in 4 days of fighting, 1 killed on May 10.

column7: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Clashes between Bul Nuer, Haak Nuer and Dok Nuer in PoC3 camp, Juba. UNMISS and police intervened to contain violence. 60 injured in 4 days of fighting, 1 killed on May 10.

column7: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Clashes between Bul Nuer, Haak Nuer and Dok Nuer in PoC3 camp, Juba. UNMISS and police intervened to contain violence. 60 injured in 4 days of fighting, 1 killed on May 10.
Soldiers and Bul Nuer allied militia rape a woman and abduct several children in Gwit.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Bul Nuer allied militia vs. SPLA/M-IO in Gwit and Koch. Unspecified number of civilians killed in Mayom, Bang, Kuer Geny, Bauw, Boreh, Gwit and Koch (10 fatalities coded for Mayom, 10 for Gwit/Koch, both battles occurring in the week of May 11).

column7: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Clashes between Bul Nuer, Haak Nuer and Dok Nuer in PoC3 camp, Juba. UNMISS and police intervened to contain violence. 60 injured in 4 days of fighting, 1 killed on May 10.

Government forces and Bul Nuer militia raped women, kidnapped boys and killed an unspecified number of civilians in Mayom, Bang, Kuer Geny, Bauw, Boreh, Gwit and Koch (10 fatalities coded for Mayom, 10 for Gwit/Koch, both battles occurring in the week of May 11).
Unknown gunmen kill Wau county paramount chief and his wife.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Bul Nuer allied militia vs. SPLA/M-IO in Gwit and Koch. UN workers report that government forces raped women, kidnapped boys and killed an unspecified number of civilians in clashes in Mayom, Gwit and Koch (10 fatalities coded for Mayom, 10 for Gwit/Koch, both battles occurring in the week of May 11).

Clashes between military /Bul Nuer allied militia vs. SPLA/M-IO in Gwit and Koch. UN workers report that government forces raped women, kidnapped boys and killed an unspecified number of civilians in clashes in Mayom, Gwit and Koch (10 fatalities coded for Mayom, 10 for Gwit/Koch, both battles occurring in the week of May 11).

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Ganyiel in Panyikiar County.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Pajut.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military retakes control of Mayendit after clashes with SPLAM-IO. Unknown number of civilians killed and abducted.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Taiyar port in Panyijiar County. Rebels claim that military used UN logos on its ferries. Government retook the port of Taiyar. At least 12 civilians killed, 10 injured. HRW reported the military ran over civilians with tanks.
Military retakes control of Mayendit after clashes with SPLAM-IO. Unknown number of civilians killed and abducted.

Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Taiyar port in Panyijiar County. Rebels claim that military used UN logos on its ferries. Government retook the port of Taiyar. Government forces deliberately target civilians and run them over in tanks resulting in 12 civilian deaths. Incidences of rape by government troops are also reported.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""An UN contracted truck hit a landmine north of Bentiu, near Torabeith. The driver sustained injuries to the leg as a result of the blast.""
200 in Waus Jou Market rioted against high cost of living, throwing stones at shops. Police fired shots in the air to disperse the crowd. Military deployed to the area.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Dinka militia vs. Olonyi rebels / SPLA/M-IO. Olonyi overtook Kodok.
5 girls abducted in Duk county in May 2015 by suspected Murle militia.

Change to armed group: In a press statement dated 15 May, a military official who claimed to be spokesperson for the Shilluk ethnic militia under the command of Major General Johnson Olony, said their militia group was now called Agwelek Forces.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Dinka militia vs. Olonyi rebels / SPLA/M-IO. Olonyi overtook Nagdiar.

column8: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Prison Guards
column17: Soldiers opened fire on Mundri prison, killing one police officer and injuring another in May 2015.
Two pastors were killed between Bailiet and Ulang Counties in Upper Nile State by government troops in the context of clashes in the area in May 2015.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Dinka militia vs. Olonyi rebels / SPLA/M-IO at Doleib Hill. Several soldiers killed in clashes at Doleib Hill and in Malakal (10 fatalities coded for each). Olonyi rebels retook control of the area.

column9: Militia (Gabriel Tang); SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Dinka militia vs. Olonyi rebels / SPLA/M-IO / Gabriel Tang Militia in Malakal. Several soldiers killed in clashes at Doleib Hill and in Malakal (10 fatalities coded for each).
Clashes in Majak-koot, Tonj South County, between two communal militias fighting over land. At least 4 killed.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi / SPLA/M-IO in Akoke.

column9: Militia (Gabriel Tang); SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes in Kodok between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO.

column9: Militia (Gabriel Tang); SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Continued clashes between military / Dinka militia vs. Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO / Gabriel Tang Militia in Malakal. Olonyis rebels captured Malakal on May 15.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO under the command of Olonyi (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) shoot down an alleged Ugandan military helicopter in Malakal. Uganda military denies the helicopter was theirs.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Continued clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO in Akoke. Olonyi captured Akoke on May 17.

column17: Continued clashes between military / Dinka militia vs. Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO / Gabriel Tang Militia in Malakal. Olonyis rebels captured Malakal on May 15.

column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO near Tangrial, 25kms from Melut. A local chief Mabong Monyluak was killed.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO in Melut. Several soldiers and rebels killed (coded as 10). 4 civilians killed when mortar bombs exploded inside a UN compound. 8 injured.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO. Olonyi captures Tangrial Bil refinery site and Foluj oil field near Paloich. 2 civilians killed. Military denies reports that rebels took control of Foluj.
Unknown group killed 2 Ngok Dinka civilians in Bier.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO. Rebels take control of Kaka.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO. Olonyis forces capture Melut. Rebels also shot down a helicopter gunship above Melut on May 20. Several soldiers and rebels killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Bul Nuer allied militia and SPLA/M-IO. Military overtakes control of Leer. At least one civilian abducted, unknown number of civilians killed and raped in Mirmir, Leer and Payak village. UPDATED fatality and added ally Bul Nuer militia.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO. Military took control of Adok.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Nyal. Military captured Nyal.

Clashes between military / Bul Nuer allied militia and SPLA/M-IO. Military overtakes control of Leer. At least one civilian abducted, unknown number of civilians killed and raped in Mirmir, Leer and Payak village. UPDATED fatality and added ally Bul Nuer militia.
A Radio Tamazuj journalist and another man shot dead by unknown gunmen in Akobo.
Reports that tribal militia targeted and killed a soldier and a civilian from the Shilluk tribe following clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Melut earlier in the day.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO. Government claims to have retaken control of Melut. Olonyis forces had captured Melut on May 20. Several soldiers and rebels killed. Reports that UN base shelled and 8 civilians killed over May 21-22 (in total, 14 fatalities coded for May 21, and 14 for May 22).
Bodies of two Dinka SPLA soldiers found. Circumstances surrounding their killing are unknown.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO. Olonyi takes control of Mangok.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Nyal. Rebels regain control of Nyal. Unspecified number of government casualties. Military had captured Nyal on May 20.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Pajut. Dozens of civilians wounded.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Continued clashes between military and Olonyi rebels (recently renamed Agwelek Forces) / SPLA/M-IO, after government reclaimed control of Melut on May 21. Several soldiers and rebels killed. Reports that UN base shelled and 8 civilians killed over May 21-22 (in total, 14 fatalities coded for May 21, and 14 for May 22).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition- Welebe: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition (Wesley Welebe Faction)
column17: Clashes between military and newly formed SPLA/M faction under the command of Wesley Weluba. Weluba faction took control of Mundri. Some reports that Arrow Boys militia also involved.

County commissioner and 6 bodyguards killed in an ambush near Mundri as they returned from investigating the killing of soldiers in Maridi. Lakes state governor initially reported to have been killed but survived the ambush.
Unknown group attacked soldiers near Maridi. 2 killed.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: """"A UN staff member was assaulted by soldiers while walking to work along Airport Road in Juba. They accused him of spying. The staff member suffered injuries to his face and bruised ribs.""""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition- Welebe: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition (Wesley Welebe Faction)
column17: Military reclaim Mundri from SPLA Weluba faction.

column6: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column8: Ajang Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Clashes between Rup and Ajang militia. 2 killed.
Clashes between Misseriya gunmen and Dinka Ngok in Mayom and Nyiel villages in Abyei on May 24 and 25. 23 killed (13 coded for May 24, 12 coded for May 25).
Wildlife service official shot and killed in Mundri.
Gunmen attack a group of fishermen In Nyinor area of Aweil. 1 injured.

column17: Ajang militia attack police station, 4 killed. 4 civilians injured.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO occupy Nyinbuoli and other areas in Aweil West and Aweil North counties previously held by government troops.

column17: Military reclaim Akoke.

Clashes between Shilluk and Dinka tribes in UNMISS base since government retook Malakal on May 25. 4 Shilluk members injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF kill 3 Dinka men.

2 killed by Murle militia in Pariak.

column17: 1 peacekeeper injured by shooting near UNMISS compound in Malakal.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO shell Melut with two mortars, targeting military troops. No injuries reported.

column17: Military forces in control of Bazia, after rebels took the town on May 31 then withdrew.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military and SPLA/M-IO shell each other across the Nile at Hai Matar near Malakal.

Cattle raiders clash with police in Abeer Payam in Rumbek Central. 2 policemen killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Laloba, Khatel-Nar and Tom South in Unity.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim to have repulsed attacks by military in Bazia. Government claimed that rebels withdrew from the area on June 1. Rebels maintain they still control the area.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Laloba, Khatel-Nar and Tom South in Unity.

column17: ""A UN contracted truck was ambushed in Lui area. The armed assailants robbed provisions off the truck and took the drivers' personal belongings. The driver and his assistant were seriously injured in the attack.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military / Tiger Division / pro-government militia vs. SPLA/M-IO in Rot Riak in area between Panakuach and Unity oil fields north of Bentiu. Unknown number of soldiers killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Continued clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Laloba.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim to have repelled an attack by military on Pariang. Unknown number of soldiers killed.

column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Kpaile Payam near Wau. Unknown number of rebels killed.

column17: ""A health mission was ambushed on-route to Manyang Ngok Primary Health Care Unit. The armed men shot and killed the driver. One INGO and one UN team member were severely injured and had to be hospitalized.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Suspected rebels ambush military convoy 20kms from Wau. 10 killed.

On 4 June 2015, clashes between military and pastoralist youth group in Akot when 1 youth was killed by military forces for looting in the area. Youth group then killed 6 policeman and 4 soldiers in retaliation. 2 civilians also killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in areas in and around Bazia.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in areas in Daba, Manyo County, near Wadakona. 2 soldiers killed, 10 wounded.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military, Tiger faction, and Shilluk militia clash with SPLA/M-IO near Paloich oilfields.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO took full control of Unity States oilfields, which are primarily in the area north of Bentiu. Military denies claims of rebel takeover of the area.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military, Tiger faction, and Shilluk militia clash with SPLA/M-IO in Panakuac north of Bentiu.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in areas in and around Bazia. 3 soldiers killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military, Tiger faction, and Shilluk militia clash with SPLA/M-IO near Paloich oilfields for second day.
Traders shut down fuel stations in Wau in protests of government restrictions on fuel price maximums.
Herdsmen threw a grenade at a cattle camp in Maridi, cattle owners responded with gunfire. 6 injured.
From June 7-9, Olonyis Agwelek Forces recruited 500-1000 children between ages 13 and 17 in Kodok and Wau Shilluk. Event coded to administrative capital Malakal.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Wadakona.
Herdsmen attacked a cattle camp in Maridi. 11 killed over June 8-9 (6 fatalities coded for June 8 and 5 fatalities for June 9). Security forces sent to the area.
Sudanese trader in Wau killed by unknown group.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim control of Buoli in Northern Bahr el Ghazal after clashes with military in Nyinbuoli, Achana, and Majok. Unknown number of fatalities.

column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Lalob and Khatel-Nar.

column17: REMNASA fighters ambushed military 4kms from Maridi. 5 killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military. Military take control of Panakuac north of Bentiu.

column8: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: National Security Services shot and killed another member of NSS and wounded one boy, in Hai Atlabara B area of Juba.
Suspected Misseriya tribesmen attack Dier and Tomac. Local youths seized AK-47s and fought back. 9 killed, 3 wounded.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Northern Bahr el Ghazal. Military captured 9 rebel officers.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Northern Bahr el Ghazal.

Riots among residents of Pochalla regarding food distribution. Fighting broke out when residents from one area of the county refused to allow residents from another part to receive food. 1 rioter and 1 policeman killed.
Sudanese trader killed in Rumbek.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO and Agwelek Forces (formerly known as Olonyi rebels) in Kaka. Some officers captured. 62 reported killed over 2 days (31 fatalities reported for June 14 and 31 for June 15).
Sudanese Air Force dropped bombs on Khor Tombak. 4 wounded.

Sudanese Air Force bombs Babanist, Atam and Sita areas of Renk and Khor Tombak in Maban Counties, killing 6 people, including an SPLA soldier. 9 wounded. (3 fatalities coded for Renk, 3 fatalities coded for Khor Tombak).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO and Agwelek Forces (formerly known as Olonyi rebels) in Kaka for second day. Some officers captured. 62 reported killed over 2 days (31 fatalities reported for June 14 and 31 for June 15).
Militiary burns houses and abducts women in Dablual.
Soldiers and Bul Nuer militia abduct civilians in Kuerginya near Gwit.
Military kills one man in Pabuong.
1 killed along Sika Rumbek road as residents of Maridi forced to leave the area following clashes with cattle herders.

column6: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Dozens of children from Liria and Jameza areas of Equatoria have been abducted by suspected Dinka Bor and Murle tribesmen.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO forces composed of Shilluk tribesmen attacked Dinka community in Atar, accusing them of hiding fighters and munitions. 6 civilians killed, either shot or cut with pangas.

Sudanese Air Force bombs Babanist, Atam and Sita areas of Renk and Khor Tombak in Maban Counties, killing 6 people, including an SPLA soldier. 9 wounded. (3 fatalities coded for Renk, 3 fatalities coded for Khor Tombak).

column6: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Dozens of children from Lanya and Mangala areas of Equatoria have been abducted by suspected Dinka Bor and Murle tribesmen.

column6: REMNASA: Revolutionary Movement for National Salvation
column17: Clashes between REMNASA vs. military and suspected Dinka allied militias in Maridi. REMNASA claim to have taken control of Maridi for five hours before withdrawing. 20 soldiers killed.
Traders protest the killing of a Sudanese trader the previous week.
Protests against the extension of Warrap governor Nyandeng Maleks term.
Clashes between Awan and Dinka Agok militias in Yirol. 4 killed.
Lawmakers boycott assembly sessions in protest over the dismissal of Lakes state assembly speaker.
Unknown gunmen shot a man dead in Mundri.
5 IDPs shot and injured in Juba marketplace.
Clashes between police and Dinka Agok youth that tried to free a friend that had been arrested. 4 killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Canal in Jonglei.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO. Rebels reclaim control of Doleib Hill. Government claims it is still in control of the area.

column8: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: IDPs protested against the closure of a market within the UN base in Malakal. UN Peacekeepers used tear gas. 5 injured. No reports of serious injuries.
Clashes between military and Agwelek Forces near Malakal. One baby injured.
Military shelled Bentiu.
Youth block the road between Yirol and Rumbek in protest of the governors decision to divert roads to another county rather than to Yirol.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO under command of Gen. Tanginye forcibly recruited boys in Fangak.
Olonys Agwelek Forces recapture control of Malakal.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes b/w military and SPLA/M-IO in Faraj Allah. Rebels claim to have captured the area. At least 2 soldiers and 3 civilians killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO reclaim control of Leer.
SPLM-N abducted two children from refugee sites in Unity state in 2015.

column7: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: SPLA/M-IO and Agwelek Forces attacked UNMISS base in Malakal, killing 1 and wounding 6. Earlier that day, the UN Security Council had imposed sanctions on three rebel and three government commanders.
Clashes between Misseriya and Dinka Ngok. At least 3 killed, 3 injured.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Prison Guards
column17: Report that at least 20 detainees have died while in government custody in Juba between February 2014 and December 2016. Conditions of detention, including torture and other ill-treatment, inadequate food, absence of clean water and inadequate access to medical care contributed to all of these deaths.

column8: Awuor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)

column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Kodok.

column17: ""A UN contracted truck driver was shot in Wullu while showering. The driver had to stop in Wullu for a few days because of bad local road conditions. He died as a result of his injuries.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO take control of Gwit. Unknown number of soldiers killed.

column17: SPLA/M-IO attack a check point at Anzara, 2 kms from Nimule, wounding one soldier

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between pro-government militia and SPLA/M-IO in southern Unity State.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

column17: At least 9 killed, dozens wounded, in clashes between Panyon and Dhiei in Rumbek East (coordinates for county capital Adull used).

2 foreign traders killed in Wau.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Non-violent activity: Rebels attack Aweil and opened fire on the house of the county commissioner. No injuries reported.

Military shelled area north of Juba.

Soldiers beat civilians in Mundri East and loot shops. 1 killed.
Military kill 2 Mundari in Jebel Ladu north of Juba.
Peaceful demonstration in Yirol West calling upon the government to handle insecurity in Lakes state.
Peaceful demonstration in Yirol East calling upon the government to handle insecurity in Lakes state.

Clashes between policemen in Khor Rumola area of Juba. 3 killed.
Soldier detonated a hand grenade in Kuajok market, killing 1, injuring 10.
Fuel operators shut down in protest of state order to reduce prices.
Military and Mundari youth clash near Juba. 15 killed.

Suspected Lou Nuer tribesmen kill 1 man on the road between Ayueldit and Poktap.

In July 2015, a pastor was killed by government soldiers based on his ethnicity at Pajut area in Jonglei.
Property destruction: Pakam youth militia burn 70 homes in Keui community of Cuei-Adukan.
