column17: SPLA/M-IO claim that military and Bul Nuer / Dinka allied militia killed over 200 civilians in Mayendit and Leer in July (100 fatalities coded for each location).
7 killed, 8 wounded in inter-clan fighting in Timic village, Rumbek Centre County county capital Rumbek coordinates used).

1 truck traveling in a convoy of 3 trucks was ambushed by unidentified armed forces at the Lando market, at the border between DRC and South Sudan. The truck was entirely looted and the assailants killed a Congolese man who was traveling in it.
3 killed in ambush along Juba-Yei road, 30km from Juba.
3 Sudanese traders injured by gunmen in Rumbek market.

Reports that military attack helicopters dropped canisters of chemical weapons/chlorine west of Juba but that some canisters did not explode.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""A UN driver and his assistant were injured when they were shot at as part of a larger convoy. The armed men shot at them after trying to extort money from the driver.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Lanyi. 10 killed. Rebels accuse military of using canisters filled with chemical weapons.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Mundri. Rebels accuse military of using canisters filled with chemical weapons.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""Two UN contracted drivers were injured in a shooting when perpetrators ambushed the convoy and fired at the truck. The gunmen fled after robbing the driver. Both the driver and his assistant received medical care.""
Reports that military attack helicopters dropped canisters of chemical weapons/chlorine east of Lui. 3 children killed.
60 people gather in Wau to protest the disappearance of a man.
Armed youth ambush Tonj East Commissioner convoy, injuring security guards.
Army soldiers used branches to whip people that were lined up for food distribution in Nyal.
Man opened fired on Nyal market, killing a bodyguard of an area commander and wounding a civilian.
Arrests: Military arrested and later released 36 people accused of supporting armed group led by James Kabila.
Property destruction: SSNLM accuse military of burning homes in Gangura south of Yambio. Gunshots heard. No casualties reported.

column6: Arrow Boys Militia-SSNA (South Sudan National Army Faction)
column7: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Change to armed group: South Sudan National Army (a faction of the Arrow Boys militia in Western Equatoria State) - 8,000 in number, led by Gen Abel Mathwo Banga - denounces alliance with military and allies with rebel SPLA/M-IO in Rangu. Defection due to lack of clarity and implementation of peace deal.

column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Two seriously injured outside UNMISS protection site in Juba along Juba-Yei road.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Health Workers (South Sudan)
column17: ""A health worker for an INGO was shot and killed while traveling between Ying and Rirnyang in Ulang County.""
Clashes between Murle and Lou Nuer militia in Akobo. Unknown number of fatalities and abductions.
At least five killed in clashes between military and unknown armed group in Bisellia.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Wadakona.
Defense forces tried to demolish shops in Kadugli market. Owners protested. Police and army fired shots in the air, injured citizens taken to hospital.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military shelled SPLA/M-IO cantonment area south of Malakal.
Armed group shot at youth in al-Daso near Bisellia, killing 2.
Clashes between Murle and Lou Nuer militia in Pibor from Feb 8-11. Heavy casualties.
Clashes between Murle and Lou Nuer militia in Pibor from Feb 8-11. Heavy casualties.
Property destruction: Military burned Gariya village. No casualties as civilians had fled the villages before the SPLA arrived.
Clashes between Murle and Lou Nuer militia in Pibor from Feb 8-11. Heavy casualties.
Property destruction: Military burned Bari village. No casualties as civilians had fled the villages before the SPLA arrived.
Soldiers beat a student severely in Ikpiro.
15 killed in clashes between Pandau and Pancuer communal militia near Cueibet.
Clashes between Murle and Lou Nuer militia in Pibor from Feb 8-11. Heavy casualties.
Military attacked and burned Lozoh near Lanyi. 3 bodies were found.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Abu Shakka.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Ezo.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Rangu.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Safa and Kapi.
Gunmen kill 2 in Thiet.
Bodies of 2 Rwandans found in River Yei.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Magwi.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Shelling and ground clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO bases in Mambe. Heavy casualties on both sides.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Medewu base in Mundri West.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Shelling and ground clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO bases in Meke, Bari, Kiri, and Loso. Heavy casualties on both sides.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Shelling and ground clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO bases in Lanyi. Heavy casualties on both sides.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Shelling and ground clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO bases in Kediba. Heavy casualties on both sides.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military attack SPLA/M-IO cantonment site in Lui. 7 children bystanders killed.
SPLA/M-IO accuse military of burning villages and killing a chief in Mundri area.

column9: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Women (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: Refugee accounts point to an attack by unknown armed men on an MSF clininc in Yei town in February 2016, which left several people killed, including elderly and disabled people, women raped and property looted.
Five bodies of disappeared men are found in a teak forest by residents. The killings are attributed to the SPLA.
A mass grave containing several bodies is found outside Yambio near Bazunga. The bodies are attributed to a campaign of enforced disappearances executed by the SPLA.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: On 17 February, military and SPLA/M-IO clashed in Tadu aand Atali areas of Wau County. 2 killed.

column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
column17: At least 29 killed over two days inside UN protection site in Malakal after fighting between Dinka and Shilluk displaced communities. UNMISS police used tear gas. Fatalitiies included 3 MSF staff. During fighting between Dinka and Shilluk militia, SPLA soldiers entered camp on night of Feb 18 and attacked Shilluk and Nuer IDPs, burning tents and killing civilians. Fatalities reported are result of both Dinka-Shilluk fighting and by military violence against civilians. Therefore, 10 fatalities coded for Feb 17 battle, 10 coded for Feb 18 battle, and 9 coded for Feb 18 violence against civilians.
Soldiers kill two unarmed young men on February 17 in the village of Natabo, west of Wau.
A Dinka allegedly found dead in Wau.
""One INGO security guard was assaulted and killed in the fighting that erupted between Dinka, Shilluk and Nuer communities in the Malakal Protection of Civilians site.""

On February 18, groups of Dinka youths armed with machetes and sticks moved from the Souq Jow market to the Hai Kalvario and Hai Falata areas of Wau, near the western exit of the city, following reports that four Dinka had been found dead. There, the Dinka youths clashed with Fertit youths. No reports of casualties.

column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
column17: At least 29 killed over two days inside UN protection site in Malakal after fighting between Dinka and Shilluk displaced communities. UNMISS police used tear gas. Fatalitiies included 3 MSF staff. During fighting between Dinka and Shilluk militia, SPLA soldiers entered camp on night of Feb 18 and attacked Shilluk and Nuer IDPs, burning tents and killing civilians. Fatalities reported are result of both Dinka-Shilluk fighting and by military violence against civilians. Therefore, 10 fatalities coded for Feb 17 battle, 10 coded for Feb 18 battle, and 9 coded for Feb 18 violence against civilians.

column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Shilluk Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column17: At least 29 killed over two days inside UN protection site in Malakal after fighting between Dinka and Shilluk displaced communities. UNMISS police used tear gas. Fatalitiies included 3 MSF staff. During fighting between Dinka and Shilluk militia, SPLA soldiers entered camp on night of Feb 18 and attacked Shilluk and Nuer IDPs, burning tents and killing civilians. Fatalities reported are result of both Dinka-Shilluk fighting and by military violence against civilians. Therefore, 10 fatalities coded for Feb 17 battle, 10 coded for Feb 18 battle, and 9 coded for Feb 18 violence against civilians.

Following clashes between Dinka and Fertit residents. SPLA soldiers fire indescriminately into Fertit neighbourhoods in Wau. At least a dozen are killed in Wau and surrounding villages by government soldiers during this time (two coded on 17th Feb)
Gunmen attacked a government official in Jubas Gudele area, kidnapping him and later releasing him.
Journalist kidnapped and tortured in Juba, released the next week.
Unknown group kills 2, injures 3 in attack on Akuc-chieng village southwest of Tonj.

column6: SSDA-Cobra: South Sudan Democratic Army (Cobra Faction)
column17: At least 5 killed in clashes on Feb 23 between Cobra faction loyal to David Yau Yau and bodyguards of newly appointed governor of Boma State Baba Medan.

column6: SSDA-Cobra: South Sudan Democratic Army (Cobra Faction)
column17: Second day of fighting between Cobra faction and bodyguards of newly appointed Boma State governor Baba Medan. 35 injured.
Turalei residents protest the establishment of the new Twic East capital at Mayen Abun.
Clashes between military and youth cattle raiders in Tonj State. 1 raider killed, 3 injured.
Clashes between unknown groups in Jur River. Several injured. Dozens arrested.
Murle militia ambush car near Jalle. 1 woman killed, 4 wounded.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""A convoy of UN trucks was travelling north of Bentiu Camp after delivering goods and were attacked by armed assailants. One of trucks was fired upon when trying to escape and the assistant driver was killed as a result.""
Journalist shot and wounded by suspected soldier in Wau.
Cattle raiders kill 12 people in Tonj East County.
LRA raided cattle and attacked Fellata herders south of Boro Medina in Raja County.
Military attack traditional chiefs home in Bussera. 3 killed.
""An INGO international staff member was assaulted by a national colleague with a metal object. The staff member's wounds required medical attention at the UN military hospital.""
Journalist kidnapped and beaten, and released alive near a graveyard in Juba.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Koch County. 1 soldier killed, 1 rebel killed over two days of fighting (1 fatality coded for Mar 7, and 1 fatality for Mar 8).
Civil servants protest over salary delays in Aweil West and Aweil North counties.
Policemen shoot and kill a soldier on his way home in Gogrial in the week of Mar 7. 6 police later arrested.
Civil servants protest over salary delays in Aweil West and Aweil North counties.
Rebels accuse military of raping 5 women in Ayod.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Nasir. At least 5 soldiers killed, 10 wounded.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military shelling and ground fighting at SPLM/A-IO positions in Panyang in Ulang County, after several soldiers reportedly defected to SPLM/A-IO. Heavy casualties reported.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military shelling and ground fighting at SPLM/A-IO positions in Nyatot payam on east bank of Sobat River. Heavy casualties reported.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military shelling and ground fighting at SPLM/A-IO positions in Torpot. Heavy casualties reported.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military shelling and ground fighting at SPLM/A-IO positions in Ketbek. Heavy casualties reported.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Koch County. 1 soldier killed, 1 rebel killed over two days of fighting (1 fatality coded for Mar 7, and 1 fatality for Mar 8).

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military shelling and ground fighting at SPLM/A-IO positions in Panyang, Nordeng, and Dhoreding.
3 children abducted by unknown group in Baidit. Rescued the following day.
Murle militia abduct 4 children from Jalle Payam. In a separate incident, unknown attackers kidnapped 3 other children from nearby Baidit.
Rioters in Gok-machar blocked rallies meant to publicise new Lol State.
Clashes between Murle militia and group in Kuei. 2 militiamen killed.
""A male national INGO worker was shot and killed in Akobo Town while he was walking on the street. The reason for the shooting is unknown and the perpetrator was not caught.""
Rioters in Nyamlell blocked rallies meant to publicise new Lol State.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Kangabar County, Northern Bahr el Ghazal State (capital Aweil used). 1 soldier killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Kangabar County, Northern Bahr el Ghazal State (capital Aweil used) for second day. On Mar 12, government forces pushed rebels out and retook control of area of Kangabar.
At least 7 killed in ambush on passenger bus travelling between Koch and Bentiu.

column7: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Shilluk Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column8: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Shilluk displaced in UNMISS camp in Malakal set fire to homes, injured 6 civilians. Peacekeepers fired warning shots. 2 IDPs detained at the scene.

column7: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Shilluk Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Shilluk displaced in UNMISS camp in Malakal set fire to homes of other refugees, injuring 6 civilians. Peacekeepers fired warning shots. 2 IDPs detained at the scene.
Education supervisor killed in Mumbai area of Yambio. 2 others also killed by unknown gunmen in the week of Mar 14 in Yambio.
Communal militia attacked Paguere in Lakes state, abducted and killed 8 children.
Unidentified gunmen killed a student in Malualkon in March.
Soldiers enter a house and non-fatally shoot two members of a family in a village west of Wau.

Clashes between SPLA and unidentified group as security officers were arresting the former Commissionner of Rumbek Central County over allegedly sheltering suspects in the killing of a student in Malualkon in March, leaving one soldier killed. The Commissionner was released eight months later.
Military killed unknown number of civilians in Nasir in March.
Cattle raiders injure 2 in Magak village in Majok payam in March 2016.
Save the Children staff member shot dead in Akobo.
6 killed, 5 injured in cattle raid in Tonj South over the weekend, between clans from Tonj and Apok vs. clans from Apok and Yar area.

Different Nuer ethnic militias fight each other with spears and machetes within UN protection site in Juba. Peacekeepers fired tear gas. At least 1 dead, 110 wounded, including 2 UNMISS peacekeeper with minor injuries.
Unknown group raided wildlife service base in Morobo, stole weapons and abducted 3 soldiers.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""Two contracted UN employees were injured when they drove over a anti-tank mine, which exploded. They were medevac'd to an UNMISS hospital and are in stable condition.""
Shootout between communal miltiias of Pochalla North and Pochalla South. No casualties.
Military reportedly raped 3 IDPs in Malakal.
Military shelled Hai town in Wau, no casualties.
Second day of fighting between communal militias from pochalla North and Pochalla South. 3 killed, 3 injured on second day.
Third day of fighting between communal militias from Pochalla North and Pochalla South. 3 killed between Mar 23 and 24 (2 fatalities coded for Mar 23, 1 for Mar 24).
Fourth day of fighting between communal militias from Pochalla North and Pochalla South. 3 killed between Mar 23 and 24 (2 fatalities coded for Mar 23, 1 for Mar 24).

A 21-year-old moto-taxi driver said he was asked by a soldier to drive him to Grinti on March 24. When they arrived at the barracks, the soldier accused him of being a rebel and detained him. He said he was held for four days and tortured, then released without charge: 'At night, they blindfolded me and took me to a room. For an hour, they beat me with a stick and rubber and asked me about the rebels.' The soldiers did not return his motorbike.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Sudan SAF bomb SPLA/M-IO in Babaneis east of Renk. No casualties.

On March 24, the burned remains of a motorcycle taxi driver, hands tied behind his back, were found behind the Catholic church. Witnesses said the men who killed him had detained him in a compound near the church occupied by soldiers, though researchers could not confirm whether the men were soldiers.
SAF accused of bombing Babaneis near Renk.
Unknown militia killed 4 and injured 4 in Mirmir in Koch County.
Clash between government forces and cattle raiders in Koch County. 2 killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO militia ambush SPLA convoy between Miriguir and Rubkuai villages in Leer County. 1 civilian bystander killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Suspected SPLA/M-IO gunmen ambush a vehicle belonging to Mayendit commissioner, 4 killed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Suspected SPLA/M-IO gunmen ambush a car carrying an SPLA brigadier travelling from Bentiu to Leer, attack occurred near Koch. 3 killed. 2 missing.
2 police killed while pursuing cattle raiders.
2 killed in ambush along Bor-Juba road. One South Sudanese and one Ugandan.
Gunmen ambush vehicle along Mangala-Juba road, critically injuring wildlife service policeman. Two killed.
Cattle raiders attack and injure a man in Twic East County.
7 killed in attack by cattle raiders in Chukudum.
Military officer killed in ambush along Kuajok-Wau road.
Unknown group ambushed a boat loaded at Mangala en route to Bor. 2 killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Mundri County near Lanyi and Lozo on Mar 31. 2 soldiers killed, several injured.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim military attacked rebel positions in Lanyi and Lozo over the weekend.

column6: SSNLM: South Sudan National Liberation Movement
column17: Agreement: Government signs peace deal with SSNLM in Yambio.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim military attacked cantonment areas in Khor Ghana in week of Apr 3.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim military attacked cantonment areas in Bushayr in week of Apr 3.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO under command of Col Both Riah and Gatluak Wal Yoh clash with military near Bentiu. 2 soldiers killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Wau County between Busari and Kurkunda and in Angu Bagari.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO under command of Col Both Riah and Gatluak Wal Yoh attacked civilians in Juac near Rubkona, 1 killed.
Unknown gunmen shoot and injure a man in Pacong village along Rumbek-Mingkaman raod.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim SSAF bombed their positions in Angunu (Angu Angu) from Apr 5- 7.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Yeri on Apr 5 and 6.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO between Loko Loko and Mboro around Apr 6. Buildings destroyed. Several soldiers injured.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim SSAF bombed their positions in Angunu (Angu Angu) from Apr 5- 7.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Wau from Apr 6-8. Heavy casualties on both sides.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Mvolo around Apr 6.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Yeri on Apr 5 and 6.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Mundri.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Wau from Apr 6-8. Heavy casualties on both sides.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim SSAF bombed their positions in Angunu (Angu Angu) from Apr 5- 7.

Arrests: Mass arrests of 154 local members of parliament and officials and their relatives in Aweil West County and in Baau, Barmayen and Alok in Aweil Central on Apr 7. Some say arrests were due to allegations that politicians had been recruited by SPLA/M-IO. Other say arrests due to politicals criticizing local finance chief Gen. James Ajonga.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM/A-IO in Wau from Apr 6-8. Heavy casualties on both sides.
Cattle raiders kill 2, injure 2 in Magok village in Majak payam.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Commissioner of Melut county claims SPLA/M-IO forces under Olonyi command shelled homes in Thag village. No casualties.

column9: Fertit Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Jur Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
column17: On and around 9 April, SPLA soldiers attacked civilians in the neighbourhoods of Lokoloko, Jai Kalavario, Baggari Kadid and Hai Jezeera of Wau town, shooting indiscriminately and accusing them of hiding rebels. At least three killed and several injured. Also incidents of rape and looting.
Clashes between Murle and Jie militia in Boma.
Displaced protest at UNHCR against planned closing of Yida camp.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Security service arrest 16 members of SPLA/M-IO in Juba, detainees beaten.

""An INGO demining convoy was ambushed on Yei- Morobo road in Central Equatoria. Two national staff members were shot and killed in the attack. The attack was reported to have been motivated by ethnic tensions.""
Vehicle ambushed outside of Yei, 2 South Sudanese staff of Danish Demining Group killed.

column7: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Presidential Security Unit
column17: Movement of forces: Over 3,000 soldiers and members of presidential security unit deployed 25km outside Juba under the terms of the Aug 2015 peace agreement.
Fire brigade in Kuajok protested non-payment of salaries by firing randomly in the air.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Rubkona county, in areas of Turkiel, Waak and Manluo.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes over cattle raiding between SPLA/M-IO and comunal militia in Riak, Tuoch-luak, Wangkel and Wichok in Mayom County west of Bentiu. Military soldiers intervened. 10 killed including 4 soldiers.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Mayom County following military intervention the day before in cattle raiding clashes between SPLA/M-IO and communal militia.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Rubkona county, in areas of Turkiel, Waak and Manluo.

column8: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Clashes between Kuei and Rup clans, with Pakam militia siding with Kuei, over land dispute in Marial-bek. 80 feared dead of 2 days, however, number of fatalities not yet verified (10 fatalities coded per day).
Three soldiers raped a 60-year-old woman in April just outside of Wau.
Clashes between military and Murle who had abducted a boy near Kolynang. One soldier wounded.
Murle militia clash with military and police in Jalle after Murle had stolen cattle. 4 wounded.
Murle militia abduct a boy in Nyinmajok in Kolnyang.

column8: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
column17: Second day of clashes between Kuei and Rup clans, with Pakam militia siding with Kuei, over land dispute in Marial-bek. 80 feared dead of 2 days, however, number of fatalities not yet verified (10 fatalities coded per day).
On 17 April 2016, at least 1 killed, 5 injured when vigilante militia clashed with cattle raiders near Pakayr.

column6: SSPPF: South Sudan Peoples Patriotic Front
column17: Change to armed group: At least 1,100 soldiers have reportedly defected from the SSPF to the SSAF/FDP. The defection was allegedly due to the SSPF signing an agreement with the government.
Murle militia killed 1 and abducted 2 children in Thon-buor near Bor.
Military and police ambush Murle militia who had abducted children, exchanged fire. 2 abducted children were rescued. 2 Murle killed.
Firemen riot over salaries, setting up road blocks and shooting in the air in the market. Some bystanders reportedly sustained injuries.
Civil servants protest salary delays.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Bagari near Wau.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Angunu (Angu Angu).
Body found in Hai 50 near Wau.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/O-IO west of Wau. 1 soldier killed.
Doctors protest over salaries.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLM/A-IO fighters attack soldiers in Malwal, Northern Bahr el Ghazal. Unknown number of soldiers killed.
Soldier shot and killed by unknown gunmen at military base in Yei.

column8: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: On 25 April, two rocket propelled grenades (RPG) were fired towards the UNMISS base in Bentiu. One of them landed outside inside UNMISS base and another inside. No fatalities or injuries.
2 SPLA officer killed each other in an exchange of fire in Mayendit County.
At least 1 killed in clashes between cattle raiders and local armed groups near UN base in Bentiu.
Unknown group clashes with military in Rumaker north of Aweil East. Unknown number killed, several soldiers injured.
Gunmen kill a herder in Wadakona.

""A INGO vehicle was targeted in a roadside ambush by an armed man while it was part of a UN agency convoy. A man appeared from the bush and fired a single shot at the car that went through the window. While the shot missed the driver, he was injured by the shattered glass and required medical attention.""

column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: IDP shot and wounded at UNs PoC site in Juba.
At least 3 soldiers dead and a general wounded after a group of soldiers fired on the generals office in Kit Kit in Raja County. 3 soldiers arrested.
Non-violent activity: South Sudan swears into office its transitional government of national unity on Apr 29.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Change to armed group: Maj. Gen. Makuach Teny Yuok, a senior military officer in the armed opposition faction of SPLA-IO, defected from the opposition faction and formed a new rebel group called the National Resistance Movement and Army (NRM/A).
SPLA accused of torturing and killing 8 men in Kajo-Keji following the return of Machar to Juba.
Gunmen reportedly killed 5, abducted 7 in Yei county over the week of May 2.
Movement of forces: Ethiopian forces have taken up positions in Pochalla and Raad following attacks on Ethiopian territory by Murle militia from South Sudan.
Unknown group ambush commercial vehicle carrying soldiers in Kormakuach along Juba-Bor road. 2 soldiers killed.
Suspected Murle militia abduct 2 children from Dong Boma of Liith Payam in Twic East.
University students in Wau riot, block roads over lack of electricity and water.
Mundari attack military forces at Koda. 1 soldier captured.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO group commanded by Peter Tang in Bilthiang in Mayom. 11 killed. Rebels deny clashes took place.
SPLA/M-IO claim that military attacked civilians in Ruokchiengfuot in Rubkona, claiming 5 civilians were killed.
Mundari militia who oppose new borders attack soldiers in Mangala who had raised the new flag for Jubek State. 3 soldiers and a woman killed.
""An INGO male staff member was shot and killed in his residence at night by unknown assailants. Another person, female, that was present at the residence, was also killed in the attack.""
At least 1 killed in cattle raid in Twic East County.
Military reportedly arrested and tortured 19 youths for supporting SPLA/M-IO.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""A UN contracted truck driver was ambushed and killed by gunmen along the Magwi-Torit road in Eastern Equatoria, South Sudan. The gunmen stole money, phones and other items. Two other people in the truck managed to escape unharmed.""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Abu Shakka and Momoi in Wau county.
Protests against creation of 28 states.
Man killed by gunmen in his house in Bussari, Wau. Unknown perpetrator however attack comes after SPLA/-IO accused government forces of attacking their positions near Wau that morning.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Change to armed group: Group aligned with SPLA/M-IO under command of Gen Dau Aturjong announce split from rebels and formation of an unnamed new group allied with military defector Gen Agany Ayili.
On or around 12 May 2016, a group of unidentified cattle raiders exchange fire with a vigilante group in Hiyala over the weekend. One cattle raider killed during the battle.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Momoi on the road to Abu Shakka in Wau county.
Five people were killed last Thursday and ten were injured by unknown gunmen in Akop in Warrap state.
A Messirya man is killed by a Dinka Malual tribesman in Aweil East. The nature of the killing is unknown but sparks tension between the two communities.
Three women were shot and killed in Akop Payam by unknown gunmen.
Agreement: Aguok and Apuk communities sign peace resolutions agreeing to disarm their militias in Warrap state.
Looting: In the course of their redeployment to Digala Boma, Rajaf County in Central Equatoria SPLA reportedly stole lands, looted crops and property and harassed people.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: State forces and SPLA-IO rebels clash in southern Rubkona county. One government officer reported killed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government and SPLA-IO forces clash in Deim Zubier. JEM assisted government troops. No casualties reported.

column7: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Suspected SPLA-IO allied rebels abducted 23 Ugandans in attacks targeting vehicles travelling along the Juba-Nimule highway in May. SPLA-IO denied the claims.

column9: Christian Group (Slovakia); Women (Slovakia); Health Workers (South Sudan)
column17: A Slovak nun is shot dead by soldiers at the Yei checkpoint as she returned from taking a woman in labor to a maternity hospital in the outskirts of town. The soldiers misconduct is said to have led to an increase in the number of young men joining rebels in the bush in the following months in the area.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government forces seize control of an area south west of Deim Zubier from rebels. No casualties reported. JEM militiamen supported government troops and kidnapped 11 Sudanese who later escaped. JEM denies assisting the military.
Gunmen attacked villages in Nyepo Payam, killing a civilian and displacing hundreds of families.
On 18 May, at least 13 people were reported killed and 7 others wounded when fighting erupted between Toposa and Didinga tribes over stolen cattle.
A man shot dead by unknown gunmen. No motive for the shooting stated in the source file.
A person was killed and over 800 cattle were stolen by the Luanyjang of Wun-Thoc in a deadly attack on Friday in Riak and Padhuony villages in North Ton (admin 2 capital used)j.
A clash between the Toposa and Didinga leaves 26 dead. 20 children were also abducted during the clashes. 7 were later recovered.
Armed Murle attack Fagak in Duk county and abduct two children and injure two civilians.
A former electoral campaign manager is killed along with his colleague in Rumbek by unknown gunmen.
At least three people were killed and two others sustained injuries in Rumbek North from a revenge attack by pastoralists from Tonj state.
""A driver from an INGO (implementing partner to a UN agency) was carjacked near Torit town by anti-government elements. The driver was kidnapped and badly beaten. He was released after 48 hours.""
A Somali fuel tanker driver was killed along the Juba-Nimule road after his vehicle was ambushed by gunmen near Nesitu about 30 km south of Juba.
The Chairperson for Yambio county land dispute committee has been non-fatally shot in Yambio town, capital of Western Equatoria state by unknown gunman.

""Two INGO contractors were physically assaulted by six unidentified persons during an attempted robbery. The victims sustained injuries were referred to an NGO clinic in order to receive medical treatment.""
Seven people are killed and another is injured by unidentified gunmen while travelling by bus on the Arua-Nimule highway.
Murle tribesmen abduct two children in Ajong Payam.

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: A soldier who killed his superior during a personal dispute goes AWOL and is later tracked down and killed in a gun battle with SPLA forces.
A woman was killed and at least two children abducted by suspected Murle raiders in Baidit Bor county.

column7: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Christian Group (South Sudan)
column17: Dinka church members rioted to force resignation of pastor because he invited Riek Machar to church the week before. Security personnel arrested several.
Clashes between refugees, primarily from Sudan, and host community during a football match in Doro. 1 refugee and 2 South Sudanese nationals killed on May 30.
Traders riot in Wanyjok, against appointment of new chairperson. Rioters clashed with members of the chairpersons office, throwing stones at each other. Several injured and one taken to hospital.
Non-violent activity: Soldiers shot at three aid boats 2kms from UN base in Malakal. No casualties.
Clashes between Toposa and Didinga militia.
Clashes between refugees, mostly from Sudan, and host community in Maban, sparked by clashes the previous day in Doro. Many injured and taken to hospital houses burned.
Second day of clashes between refugees from Sudan and host community in Maban. Many injured and taken to hospital, houses burned.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a community leader in Yei, increasing tensions and insecurity in the county.
Unknown gunmen stormed military base in Sopo and Mangaia areas of Raga County. No information on how many killed or wounded, if any.

Six unidentified gunmen in uniform kidnapped a journalist and his brother in their family home in Kerepi village along the Juba-Nimule road. The journalist was killed soon after but his death was only uncovered three months later, in September. Witnesses say the suspects were wearing Tiger Batallion uniforms, from the Presidents guard.
Unknown gunmen stormed military base in Sopo and Mangaia areas of Raga County. No information on how many killed or wounded, if any.
Gunmen attack Nyuack in Twic East County. 4 injured. Differing reports accuse Murle militia or Cobras Militia. Coded as unidentified armed group.
2 killed, 2 injured in attack on commercial vehicle near Ngong near contested area of Abyei.

""Armed men entered an INGO compound through a perimeter fence and tricked the staff into opening the door. The men were armed with machetes and assaulted the staff and guards. Two international aid workers had to medically evacuated to South Africa for treatment.""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Military and armed men loyal to Machars SPLA/M-IO clashed in Kansuk of Kajo-Keji county. 21 soldiers killed, dozens wounded on both sides. Reports of 3 civilians also killed. 1500 displaced. Clashes supposedly sparked when soldiers did not want to pay for goods from sellers in the market, and opposition forces loyal to Machar saw the verbal disagreement between soldiers and merchants and decided to intervene with force. Reports that during the fighting, army units from Juba and from Mundari in central Kajo-Keji were sent as reinforcements. Both were ambsuhed en route to Kansuk, with unknown number of people killed in the ambush on the Mundari unit. Fatalities for events in Kansuk and Mundari (Kansuk coordinates used) is 34 (21 soldiers, 3 civilians, and 10 coded for unknown number of lives lost in road ambush near Mundari).
Unknown gunmen shot and killed security guard working at US embassy in Juba.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Army unit from Juba sent as reinforcement for clashes between military and armed men loyal to Machars SPLA/M-IO occurring in Kansuk. Army unit ambushed en route from Juba. No casualties reported specifically for Juba-Kansuk ambush.
SPLA/M-IO commander accused government forces of killing 2 civilians in Bazia.
SPLA reportedly violently intervened and fired shots during a student election at the University of Juba to disrupt the election.

On 14 and 15 June, an unknown armed group attacked the SPLA and government offices in Raja town resulting in fighting with the SPLA. The gunmen took control of the town for several hours, but JEM reinforcements arrived and re-captured the town. At least 35 soldiers killed, including governors bodyguards, and 13 wounded. Government vehicles attempting to leave the city were ambushed and burnt, while Red Cross vehicles were looted. Reports that tribal leaders in the area have rejected President Kiirs proposed creation of Lol State, although identity of attackers remains unconfirmed.
SPLA/M-IO commander accused government forces of killing 1 civilian in Gettan.

On 14 and 15 June, an unknown armed group attacked the SPLA and government offices in Raja town resulting in fighting with the SPLA. The gunmen took control of the town for several hours, but JEM reinforcements arrived and re-captured the town. At least 35 soldiers killed, including governors bodyguards, and 13 wounded. Government vehicles attempting to leave the city were ambushed and burnt, while Red Cross vehicles were looted. Reports that tribal leaders in the area have rejected President Kiirs proposed creation of Lol State, although identity of attackers remains unconfirmed.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: On 15 June, SPLA and SPLA-IO clashed in Bazia and along the Bazia-Wau road. SPLA soldiers and civilians killed.
Change to armed group: Surrender/Defect:A police commander loyal to the government claimed that a large number of police defected and joined rebels in the Raja area prior to the towns over-run.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: NSS officers halted a Protocol Driver for Riek Machar on his motor vehicle in Juba, confiscating his property, tieding, blindfolding and beating him repeatedly, and threatened to kill him. In another incident, NSS officers fired at a second Protocol vehicle for the FVP after its driver failed to comply with their orders to pull over.
2 killed, 2 injured by tribal group in Deri Island, Mangalla.

column9: Catholic Christian Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
column17: SPLA shot and killed a Sister of the Catholic Diocese of Yei while on medical duty. Despite reports of arrests and investigations, justice had not yet been done as of February 2017.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO claim that national security agents fired at Machars car in Juba on June 16. No casualties reported.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO soldiers attacked a government forces patrol at the Leer airstrip in Unity. Three SPLA and two IO soldiers were wounded. CTSAMM assessessed that the patrol were in violation of the PCTSA.
On 19 June 2016, after cattle raiders took cattle from Aliet, vigilante militia pursued and clashed with the raiders. 1 vigilante member and 1 cattle raider injured.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Intelligence agents shoot at the car of the SPLA-IO share command Cdr. John Mabiek Gaar at Mongateen on 19/6/2016

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government forces attack SPLA/O-IO positions in Payak near Leer. 2 soldiers killed, 1 injured. One civilian also injured.
3 killed, 2 wounded of Dinka Ngok ethnic group in car ambush in Aniet-Ngong, in contested Abyei area.
Unknown gunmen abduct governors camerman from Jebel-Khair neighbourhood of Wau.
2 soldiers killed in Wau.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLM/A-IO commander admits that opposition forces opened fire on residential areas of Wau on June 23.

column16: Al Jazeera; UN HRC; Radio Tamazuj
column17: On 24 and 25 June, soldiers and police joined armed Dinkas in a clash with armed youth from the Fertit community in Wau. SPLA soldiers deliberately targeted civilian populations and looted hundreds of shops and huts. Between 39-69 bodies were collected and recorded by the police as having been killed, including at least 15 women and 10 children. It is unclear how many of the fatalities were deliberately targeted and how many died in the crossfire. Fatalities split between battles and violence against civilians events.

column16: Al Jazeera; UN HRC; Radio Tamazuj
column17: On 24 and 25 June, soldiers and police joined armed Dinkas in a clash with armed youth from the Fertit community in Wau. SPLA soldiers deliberately targeted civilian populations and looted hundreds of shops and huts. Between 39-69 bodies were collected and recorded by the police as having been killed, including at least 15 women and 10 children. It is unclear how many of the fatalities were deliberately targeted and how many died in the crossfire. Fatalities split between battles and violence against civilians events.

Youth rioted and blocked roads with chopped trees in Diabio village, blocking access to minister Grace Datrio, who was there to discuss agriculture needs. Rioters clashed with military escorting the minister, 12 wounded.

column16: Al Jazeera; Radio Tamazuj; UN HRC
column17: On 24 and 25 June, soldiers and police joined armed Dinkas in a clash with armed youth from the Fertit community in Wau. SPLA soldiers deliberately targeted civilian populations and looted hundreds of shops and huts. Between 39-69 bodies were collected and recorded by the police as having been killed, including at least 15 women and 10 children. It is unclear how many of the fatalities were deliberately targeted and how many died in the crossfire. Fatalities split between battles and violence against civilians events.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; Al Jazeera; UN HRC
column17: On 24 and 25 June, soldiers and police joined armed Dinkas in a clash with armed youth from the Fertit community in Wau. SPLA soldiers deliberately targeted civilian populations and looted hundreds of shops and huts. Between 39-69 bodies were collected and recorded by the police as having been killed, including at least 15 women and 10 children. It is unclear how many of the fatalities were deliberately targeted and how many died in the crossfire. Fatalities split between battles and violence against civilians events.

Arrests: Governor Elias Waya was arrested on orders of the army chief of staff a day after being dismissed by President Kiir for declaring a state of emergency in Wau without informing the government in Juba. As of October 2016, he was remaining in detention at the Giyada military barracks in Juba.
Movement of forces: Army deployed to Li Rangu to boost security in the wake of ""skirmishes"". No further reports on what events occurred.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO reportedly attacked the Rubkwai military base in Leer, killing three (including a policeman) and wounding another two soldiers. SPLA-IO claimed one fatality on its side.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA-IO forces attacked the Rubpchai Barracks and headquarters of the County Commissioner in Mayendit County, leaving four killed, including three SPLA soldiers, and 11 wounded, including two among SPLA.
Gunshots heard near police station in Yei. One officer wounded in the head.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between government and opposition forces in Rubkai area of Leer. No mentioned casualty.
Military arrest and beat an off-duty soldier for wearing army boots while in plain clothes.
Arrests: Authorities arrested and detained the Ceasefire and Transitional Security Arrangements Monitoring Mechanism (CTSAMM) team leader in Torit.
At least 2 farmers killed and another wounded by suspected Misseriya militia in Machar Akoon village near Toc Chol in Aweil East (capital Malualkon used).

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Prison Guards
column17: Report that at least 20 detainees have died while in government custody in Juba between February 2014 and December 2016. Conditions of detention, including torture and other ill-treatment, inadequate food, absence of clean water and inadequate access to medical care contributed to all of these deaths.
Shilluk leaders accused Agwelek commander General Johnson Olony of killing a senior Agwelek officer from a section of the Shilluk tribe in Lelo area of Upper Nile in 2016.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Suspected government security personnel shot dead George Gismala, an SPLA/O-IO officer working in the transitional governments military intelligence, in Kator area of Juba.
Government forces attacked Lodu near Torit, firing shots into the air and beating civilians in an effort to cause opposition forces to confront military forces.
Weapons Seizure: 200 firearms collected from Galweng militia as part of disarmament agreement.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between military and SPLA/M-IO in Loronyo.
Government forces directly targeted and assaulted women and girls in Loronyo demanding to know the location of rebel groups. Civilian villages also burned and looted.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: After government forces directly targeted civilians in Lodu near Torit, military clashed with opposition forces. Unknown number of casualties.

column9: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movementa-In Opposition
column17: Military suspected of killing a SPLA/M-IO soldier, who was formerly a national security officer, Domach Koat Pinyien. He was shot dead in Gudele area of Juba, after being kidnapped. His body was found the next morning.
RPG fired in Hai Mauna neighbourhood. 3 injured from Moru tribe.
Clashes over land involving two communal groups.

""One INGO national staff member was killed by armed men who ambushed a private vehicle on the Torit-Kapoeta road in Eastern Equatoria. Other passengers in the car were robbed of their belongings, including cash, but were otherwise unharmed. The circumstances surrounding the killing of the INGO staff member are currently unknown.""

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: SPLA/M-IO attacked Tamar and killed one, wounded one civilian.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: ""On 06th July 2016 at Mundri Centre a UN-contracted truck driver was shot dead for an unknown reason while his truck had been parked overnight. The truck was transporting food commodities from Uganda to Wunrok but the cargo remained intact.""

column9: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Unknown group killed one civilian at the gates of the UNMISS camp in Bentiu.

column9: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Clashes over land involving two communal groups for second day. 3 injured on July 6. Police and military intervened on second day of fighting.

column6: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Non-violent activity: Government security officials shot at US embassy vehicle, no casualties. US embassy believes the vehicles were not specifically targeted.

column7: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Al Jazeera; AP
column17: Government forces clashed with SPLA/M-IO at a checkpoint in Gudele. 3 military and 2 national security members killed, 2 wounded. 2 SPLA/M-IO wounded and 1 missing. Reports of possible civilian casualties during the clash.

column9: UNESCO: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
column17: Head of UNESCO office, an Egyptian nation, shot and wounded in Tomping area of Juba. In a separate incident the same night in Juba a US embassy vehicle was shot at, with no casualties.
Heavy shelling heard south of Wau.
Unknown attackers targeted the home of John Garangs relatives, 2 killed outside the gates.

column7: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Presidential Security Unit
column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: AFP; Al Jazeera; Sudan Tribune; Deutsche Welle; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO vs. military and presidential security units outside presidential palace and ministry offices in Jubas Hai Amarat neighbourhood, while President Kiir was meeting with VPs Riek Machar and James Wani. 80 soldiers and 44 SPLA/M-IO officers killed outside presidential palace, and company buildings in the area hit by artillery or RPGs. At least 272 soldiers and civilian bystanders killed throughout Juba on July 8 (including 124 fatalities coded for Hai Amarat, 7 for Tomping, 7 for Jabel, 6 for UN House, and 6 for Juba Bridge). Hai Amarat is only area to have reportedly involved the presidential security unit in clashes.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Deutsche Welle; Al Jazeera; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO vs. military and presidential security units outside presidential palace and ministry offices in Jubas Hai Amarat neighbourhood, while President Kiir was meeting with VPs Riek Machar and James Wani. 80 soldiers and 44 SPLA/M-IO officers killed outside presidential palace, and company buildings in the area hit by artillery or RPGs. At least 272 soldiers and civilian bystanders killed throughout Juba on July 8 (including 124 fatalities coded for Hai Amarat, 7 for Tomping, 7 for Jabel, 6 for UN House, and 6 for Juba Bridge). Hai Amarat is only area to have reportedly involved the presidential security unit in clashes.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO vs. military and presidential security units outside presidential palace and ministry offices in Jubas Hai Amarat neighbourhood, while President Kiir was meeting with VPs Riek Machar and James Wani. 80 soldiers and 44 SPLA/M-IO officers killed outside presidential palace, and company buildings in the area hit by artillery or RPGs. At least 272 soldiers and civilian bystanders killed throughout Juba on July 8 (including 124 fatalities coded for Hai Amarat, 7 for Tomping, 7 for Jabel, 6 for UN House, and 6 for Juba Bridge). Hai Amarat is only area to have reportedly involved the presidential security unit in clashes.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The South Sudan Ambassador has accused the SPLA-IO of killing civilians in Juba and Yei during the recent violence and says that the killings are currently being confirmed by UN investigations.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: The South Sudan Ambassador has accused the SPLA-IO of killing civilians in Juba and Yei during the recent violence and says that the killings are currently being confirmed by UN investigations.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO vs. military and presidential security units outside presidential palace and ministry offices in Jubas Hai Amarat neighbourhood, while President Kiir was meeting with VPs Riek Machar and James Wani. 80 soldiers and 44 SPLA/M-IO officers killed outside presidential palace, and company buildings in the area hit by artillery or RPGs. At least 272 soldiers and civilian bystanders killed throughout Juba on July 8 (including 124 fatalities coded for Hai Amarat, 7 for Tomping, 7 for Jabel, 6 for UN House, and 6 for Juba Bridge). Hai Amarat is only area to have reportedly involved the presidential security unit in clashes.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: According to a Health Ministry source 272 people, including 33 civilians, were killed on Friday alone in the South Sudanese capital. Fatalities split among locations around Juba.
15 Kenyan truck drivers and 6 Ugandans are shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Jebel town, outside of Juba.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO vs. military and presidential security units outside presidential palace and ministry offices in Jubas Hai Amarat neighbourhood, while President Kiir was meeting with VPs Riek Machar and James Wani. 80 soldiers and 44 SPLA/M-IO officers killed outside presidential palace, and company buildings in the area hit by artillery or RPGs. At least 272 soldiers and civilian bystanders killed throughout Juba on July 8 (including 124 fatalities coded for Hai Amarat, 7 for Tomping, 7 for Jabel, 6 for UN House, and 6 for Juba Bridge). Hai Amarat is only area to have reportedly involved the presidential security unit in clashes.
Youth rioters stopped aid vehicles and beat driver, protesting against drivers being hired from areas outside of Bor. Same group also attacked two other vehicles in Bor belonging to health agencies.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Dhieu Mathok, the secretary general of the SPLM-IO party and energy minister in South Sudans new unity government was abducted and tortured by unnamed police officers. Five suspects were arrested in August and pardoned by Mathok in March 2017 as president Kiir announced a national dialogue to reconcile populations in the country.
Clashes between government forces and armed groups in Torit in Eastern Equatoria on 9 July following outbreak of violence in Juba. No reported fatality.
Unknown group attacked military barracks in Obmasi Kakwa and Mugo areas in Otogo near Yei. 1 soldier wounded.
Gunshots heard near police and prison areas of Magwi.

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UN: United Nations
column17: Reports of targeting of UN and international NGO personnel, premises and assets in Juba allegedly by SPLA soldiers. At least one South Sudanese NGO worker killed.

column8: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column16: Centre for Civilians in Conflict; UNSC; AP
column17: In the course of fighting between SPLA and SPLA-IO forces near the UN base in Jubas Jebel area, the two parties fired indiscriminately. A large number of bullets, high-calibre weapons and shells struck the two POC sites in the UN base, leaving at least 50 civilians inside the POC sites killed between 10-12 July, including around 30 on the 10th, more than 160 injured, including UN staff, and causing significant property destruction, including to International Medical Corps maternity ward and to the tents of many NGOs operating in the base. In the course of the fighting, two Chinese peacekeepers were also killed and another six peacekeepers were injured by shelling while patrolling in the vicinity of the UN Jebel HQ on 10 July.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Radio Tamazuj; Centre for Civilians in Conflict
column17: Government forces overrun the SPLA-IOs cantonment area of Jebel in Juba and scatter the rebel forces. 6 Ugandans are reported killed in the crossfire by tanks. At the same time, a large number of bullets, high-calibre weapons and shells struck the two POC sites in the UN base, leaving at least 50 civilians inside the POC sites killed between 10-12 July, including around 30 on the 10th, more than 160 injured, including UN staff, and causing significant property destruction, including to International Medical Corps maternity ward and to the tents of many NGOs operating in the base.
Government soldiers attacked the house of the Nul Buer governor of Bentiu which was sheltering hundreds of Nuer. The governors bodyguards fought off the attackers.

Non-violent activity: Government soldiers opened fire, including with heavy weapons and at least 3 tank shells which missed, on the home of the Shilluk king who was hosting about 100 Shilluk civilians during violence in Juba. No casualties resulted from the incident however.

column9: SSRC: South Sudan Red Cross; Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: Shelling by unidentified group reportedly hit and seriously damaged the South Sudan Red Cross warehouse in Juba.
A shell hits an IDP camp in Juba killing one and injuring 8. It is not known who fired the shell.

column9: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
column16: Amnesty International; Centre for Civilians in Conflict
column17: Reports of SPLA firing on Nuer civilians in their homes in Tomping as well as civilians seeking refuge from fighting between SPLA and SPLA-IO at the UNMISS Tonping base, blocking entrance at the main gates. No report of fatalities but dozens of injuries.
A fight occurrs between government forces and the government appointed guards of a government military commander of Nuer ethnicity. One SPLA commander killed.

SPLA soldiers surrounded and randomnly shot at the Biedlla hotel on Tombora Road in Juba's Atlabara neighbourhood, which was known for hosting prominent Nuer politicians. A large group of Nuer were staying at the hotel at the time of the attack. At least one person was killed by the government forces as he tried to escape. A number of Nuer civilians were also reportedly abducted by government forces in Juba throughout the course of the fighting, and remained unaccounted for four months later.
""One INGO driver was detained at a security checkpoint in Juba and physically assaulted. He had to be hospitalized as a result of his injuries.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Fighting between the SPLA and SPLA-IO in the Gudele area of Juba. No casualties reported.
Gunfire reported in Wau town. The violence is reported to involve SPLA soldiers firing at one another.
Five Ugandans are killed near the boarder by unidentified gunmen.
Gunfire and attacks on police reported in Torit.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: Centre for Civilians in Conflict; Amnesty International
column17: In the course of fighting between SPLA and SPLA-IO forces near the UN base in Jubas Jebel area, the two parties fired indiscriminately. A large number of bullets, high-calibre weapons and shells struck the two POC sites in the UN base, leaving at least 50 civilians inside the POC sites killed between 10-12 July, including around 30 on the 10th, more than 160 injured, including UN staff, and causing significant property destruction, including to International Medical Corps maternity ward and to the tents of many NGOs operating in the base. In the course of the fighting, two Chinese peacekeepers were also killed and another six peacekeepers were injured by shelling while patrolling in the vicinity of the UN Jebel HQ on 10 July.

Three soldiers who were guarding SPLA Brig-Gen. Lul Ruai, the spokesman of South Sudans army loyal to President Salva Kiir, are killed. Witnesses could not confirm whether they were killed by the SPLA-IO or some other group.

""One international staff member was seriously beaten by local youth in Mingkaman, South Sudan. Due to the severity of the injuries, the staff member had to be medically evacuated to another hospital. The incident was reportedly the result of a local contractual dispute.""

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

column9: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Civilians (International); Aid Workers (International)
column17: ""An INGO vehicle was ambushed on the Lyria, Nesitu Junction road in Central Equatoria, South Sudan. The unknown armed assailants killed one local INGO worker (medic) and seriously wounded an additional international and two national staff members while they were travelling in Nesitu on their way to Nimule. The motive and perpetrators of the attack are unknown but it was reported that the team was withdrawing from anti-government forces that were approaching the area.""

column6: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-) Presidential Security Unit
column9: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Journalists (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: A force of between 80-100 uniformed soldiers believed to be a part of the Presidential Guard (Tiger Battalion) overran the upscale Terrain Hotel a residential complex for the staff of international organizations. Over a four-hour period, they beat and abused many of the residents, raped and gang-raped at least five international aid workers and an unknown number of staff working at the compound, and executed a Nuer employee of a non-governmental news organization in an ethnically targeted killing. The soldiers damaged every single room and looted the compound extensively, stealing over 25 vehicles. Later in October, eight people were accused of rape, eight others of looting and one of injuring a victim, most from the SPLA.

column9: Kuku Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
column17: SPLA soldiers reportedly arrested eight Nuer civilians during house-to-house searches in Jubas Munuki area and took them to two nearby hotels, where they shot four of them. column16: Amnesty International; Centre for Civilians in Conflict
column17: In the course of fighting between SPLA and SPLA-IO forces near the UN base in Jubas Jebel area, the two parties fired indiscriminately. A large number of bullets, high-calibre weapons and shells struck the two POC sites in the UN base, leaving at least 50 civilians inside the POC sites killed between 10-12 July, including around 30 on the 10th, more than 160 injured, including UN staff, and causing significant property destruction, including to International Medical Corps maternity ward and to the tents of many NGOs operating in the base. In the course of the fighting, two Chinese peacekeepers were also killed and another six peacekeepers were injured by shelling while patrolling in the vicinity of the UN Jebel HQ on 10 July.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Government forces allegedly attack SPLA-IO positions in Angu Angu, Brenji, Farajalla, Angsa and Bazia in Wau county. SPLA-IO forces withdraw from Angu-Angu, Beringi and Bazia. One person confirmed killed in the multiple attacks.

On 12 July 2016, South Sudanese security forces (presumed to be army) arrested and tortured a 23 year-old civilian, whom they suspected was providing food to SPLM-IO rebels. As of August 2020, there is no information on the whereabouts of the victim.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

column6: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Non-violent activity: UNMISS forces reportedly fired teargas on civilians with little or no warning as they reportedly struggled to manage an approximate 5,000 IDPs having fled the POC1 site to seek shelter from gunfire at the core UN house base. Peacekeepers had reportedly left their posts in POC1 the day before amid fighting and the IDPs were left with no protection.

Unknown gunmen ambushed a government military convoy in Mitika, south of Yei, leaving 17 SPLA soldiers killed. After the incident, soldiers returning to Yei joined by armed Dinkas killed four local civilians, including a shop owner in the Dar es-Salam market.

Pro-government protesters demonstrate against a the proposal by the AU and IGAD to send more troops to stabilise South Sudan under a use of force mandate. Some demonstrators loot properties belonging to foreigners and beat shop owners.
Protesters, joined by members of the local government, march against the proposed deployment of foreign troops in South Sudan in Kuajok.

people in Torit protest against proposed deployment of foreign troops to South Sudan.

column17: Clashes were reported between SPLA-IO and government forces around Mugwo, south of Yei on the Kaya Highway. No casualties were reported.

column17: An SPLA-IO spokesman claimed that fighting had occurred with forces loyal to Presidnet Kiir around the Rubkuai area of Mayendit. No casualties were reported.

Around 8 August, suspected SPLA soldiers attempted to stop two women fetching water in Yei town. One managed to escape and hide in the nearby bush, but from her hiding place, the other saw the soldiers interrogate her friend and physically assault and rape her. Other incidents of rape by SPLA soldiers were reported in August.

24 SPLA soldiers and 22 civilians, including the Mayendit county commissioner, were killed and 30 injured in an attack by unidentified gunmen in the Rubkuai area of Mayendit. About 6,000 head of cattle were also taken. The attackers were allegedly from Koch county.

Fighting in Lafon town on 8 and 15 August between SPLA and armed groups. On 8 August, armed groups reportedly gained control of the town, while on 15 August, SPLA came to retake the area from them. During the violence, reports of mistreatment of civilians by armed groups, forced recruitment by armed groups as well as forced displacement, abductions, sexual violence and heavy looting of nutrition supplies, medicines, schools and houses. The entire population of the town was displaced and as of four months later, only half had returned.

At least 3 people were killed in an alleged attempted assassination by unidentified assailants against the governor of Gdudue as his convoy traveled through Yambio. At least 3 of the governors bodyguards were also injured, while the governors military escort successfully fought off the attackers.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An SPLA-IO spokesman claimed that fighting had occurred with forces loyal to Presidnet Kiir around Renk, Nasir, Maban and Raga. No casualties were reported.

SPLA forces and unidentified armed men clashed in the Kimba Payam of Morobo County. The fight started near a funeral, resulting in fatalities among both the civilians and armed men (coded as 10). The SPLA forces repulsed the attackers.
SPLA gang-raped six women in Mayendit county in Unity state.

column17: Fighting was reported between SPLA-IO and forces loyal to President Kiir around Lainya county. SPLA-IO forces allegedly repulsed the opposing force. No casualties were reported.

Citizens of Maridi county have accused the government of air attacks on their area between Aug.10-11. A resident of Maridi town claimed many people were killed or wounded in the area (coded as 10).

An SPLM-IO spokesman claimed that government air forces have been bombing Ulang county area between around Aug.10-Aug.16. Sometime during the week of Aug.10, 13 people were allegedly killed in airstrikes on the Nyanyar and Guorbi areas.

Some unidentified people cut down the state flag in Maridi during the night. 5 youths were later arrested over the incident.

45 people were killed and dozens injured when armed youth, allegedly from Koch county, clashed with government forces in Tharjiathbor county of Unity state. At least some of those injured were humanitarian workers.

column8: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

2 SPLA soldiers were killed in an ambush by gunmen on the Khor Dababa area of Bor-Juba highway over the weekend.

An SPLM-IO spokesman claimed that government air forces have been bombing Ulang county area between around Aug.10-Aug.16. Sometime in the week of Aug.10, 13 people were allegedly killed in airstrikes on the Nyanyar and Guorbi areas.

In an incident in August 2016, seven armed SPLA or SPLA-affiliated soldiers attacked mourners at a funeral in the Lainya area, between Juba and Yei. The soldiers physically assaulted mourners demanding they admit that the deceased was a combatant affiliated with the SPLM/A in Opposition. When one of the mourners protested that the deceased was an old man who died of natural causes, soldiers took him and a woman to the nearby bush where they raped the woman in the presence of the man, and then shot her. The woman was later found dead. SPLA soldiers also shot the man in the stomach. He narrated what had happened hours before dying from his injuries.
Reports of civilians being killed, raped and abducted and of the forced recruitment of children in areas including Guit in Unity in August and September.
Three humanitarian workers were killed in August in South Sudan in unclear circumstances.
Unconfirmed reports of looting and rape carried out by government forces in the areas where it fought SPLA-IO positions in Leer in August.

Clashes between Dinka Ngok and Beli communities in Bahr Gel of Lakes state following the creation of new states in the region. No mentioned fatality. The clashes are said to have continued through to January 2017.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: 1 person was killed and 4 injured when unidentified gunmen attacked a vehicle carrying ""national security personnel"" on Torit-Kapoeta road. SPLA-IO fighters are believed to be behind attacks on this stretch of road.

Fighting in Lafon town on 8 and 15 August between SPLA and armed groups. On 8 August, armed groups reportedly gained control of the town, while on 15 August, SPLA came to retake the area from them. During the violence, reports of mistreatment of civilians by armed groups, forced recruitment by armed groups as well as forced displacement, abductions, sexual violence and heavy looting of nutrition supplies, medicines, schools and houses. The entire population of the town was displaced and as of four months later, only half had returned.

column7: Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan); Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Report of hundreds of people arbitrarily arrested by military security agencies and armed Dinkas between May and November and detained for several months without charge in Yei. Most were accused of harboring and coordinating with rebels. 22 youths were released end October. HRW confirmed that at least three detainees died in the Yei military barracks due to malnutrition and sustained beatings by soldiers, while a number were also reported to have disappeared from their cells after they were detained and might have been executed by soldiers. Some of the released victims mentioned nearly 80 have been killed in detention and denounced treatment in the cells as inhumane. There were also cases of soldiers preventing detainees relatives from bringing them food and, in some cases, beating or extorting the relatives.

column9: UN: United Nations; Aid Workers (South Sudan)
column17: Report of two incidents of SPLA violence against UN workers in August, amid rising incidents targeting aid workers in the country: in one incident, two SPLA soldiers allegedly stopped a UN vehicle and threatened to kill the international workers; in another, soldiers beat a UN truck driver with an electric cord in Juba.
In August, report that government soldiers went door to door looting goods and killing and raping people in Luikor and Nyapo villages of Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria.

An SPLM-IO spokesman claimed that government air forces have been bombing Ulang county area between around Aug.10-Aug.16. Specifically, the Nyanyar area was hit on Aug.16, killing ""many civilians"" and injuring others. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

An SPLA soldier turned himself in after killing a trader on Marol Deng Geng road in Malual County.
5 people have been killed and 8 others wounded in communal clashes in Imatong in Torit East County.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: 2 people were killed in an ambush in the Camp 15 area along the Torit-Kapoeta road. A policeman was with the convoy of vehicles assaulted, while one of those killed was the Ugandan driver of a vehicle. The repeated attacks along this road are believed to have been the work of SPLA-IO fighters.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An SPLA-IO spokesman said at least 7 government soldiers and 3 SPLA-IO fighters were killed, while others were injured in clashes when the government attacked SPLA-Io positions in the northern part of Leer between Aug.18-19. At least 450 head of livestock were allegedly stolen by government forces and then recovered by SPLA-IO forces, but this could not be confirmed.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: An SPLA-IO spokesman said at least 7 government soldiers and 3 SPLA-IO fighters were killed, while others were injured in clashes when the government attacked SPLA-Io positions in the northern part of Leer between Aug.18-19. At least 450 head of livestock were allegedly stolen by government forces and then recovered by SPLA-IO forces, but this could not be confirmed. Clashes between government and opposition forces in Leer in August forced 700 families to flee to the UN camp in Bentiu town.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column16: AP; Sudan Tribune; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj
column17: SPLA-IO forces attacked government positions in the Pajut area, but were repulsed. Official figures released by the state governor claim that around 275 people were killed, including 10 civilians, 23 government soldiers, and at least 242 rebels.
